Title: UPDATE 1-Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 pct,Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 percent,Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 pct
Body: * Sees Q2 op profit at 3.7 trln won vs 3.9 trln wonconsensus,SEOUL Samsung Electronics, the world's top maker of memory chips and televisions, estimated its April-June operating profit would fall 26 percent year on year, as its LCD display business is widely expected to report another loss., SEOUL, July 7 Samsung Electronics ,the world's top maker of memory chips and televisions, estimatedits April-June operating profit would fall 26 percent year onyear, as its LCD display business is widely expected to reportanother loss.

Title: Key US senator calls for special cyber security panel
Body: WASHINGTON, July 13 Republican Senator JohnMcCain called on Wednesday for the creation of a bipartisanpanel to draft long-sought legislation to combat data breachesand espionage aimed at U.S. companies and defense networks.

Title: Government contactor Booz Allen hit by hack,Government contactor Booz Allen hit by hack,BRIEF-Moody's sees slow recovery on Sony's profitability
Body: WASHINGTON Hackers said on Monday they broke into the computer systems of major government contractor Booz Allen Hamilton's., WASHINGTON, July 11 Hackers said on Monday theybroke into the computer systems of major government contractorBooz Allen Hamilton's ., * Moody's sees slow recovery in Sony's profitability as aconcern

Title: UPDATE 5-Samsung Q2 falls as weak LCDs overshadow mobiles,Instant View: Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 percent
Body: * Estimates Q2 sales at 39 trln won vs 40 trln won consensus,SEOUL Samsung Electronics, the world's top maker of memory chips and televisions, estimated its April-June operating profit would fall 26 percent year on year, as its LCD display business is widely expected to report another loss.

Title: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Sony India sees sales growth slowing to 35 pct this fiscal year,Sony India sees FY12 sales growth slowing to 35 percent,Sony India sees annual sales growth slowing to 35 pct
Body: * Expects inflation, interest rates to crimp demand in India,MUMBAI Sony India, a unit of Japan's Sony Corp , expects sales growth in the current financial year to slow down by nearly a quarter from a year earlier as stubbornly high inflation and rising interest rates dent demand, a top official said., MUMBAI, July 12 Sony India, a unit of Japan'sSony Corp , expects sales growth in the currentfinancial year to slow down to 35 percent compared with a 46percent rise a year ago, a top official told reporters onTuesday.

Title: "Transformers" global box office hits $645 million,UPDATE 1-'Transformers' global box office hits $645 million,The top films at the North American box office,'Transformers' controls box office for 2nd week
Body: LOS ANGELES Big-budget action film "Transformers: Dark of the Moon" won the battle of the box office for the second-straight weekend, generating $140 million in global ticket sales and pushing its worldwide total since its debut to $645 million, studio estimates showed on Sunday., * 'Horrible Bosses,' 'Zookeeper' also appeal to fans (Adds details on global sales, other top films), LOS ANGELES, July 10 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for weekend beginningon July 8, led for the second straight week by "Transformers:Dark of the Moon," according to studio estimates compiled onSunday by Reuters., LOS ANGELES, July 10 Big-budget action film"Transformers: Dark of the Moon" won the battle of the NorthAmerican box office for the second straight week, churning up$47 million and easily beating two new comedies, according tostudio estimates on Sunday.

Title: Can school reformer Joel Klein reform News Corp?,NEWSMAKER-Can school reformer Joel Klein reform News Corp?,Final "Harry Potter" wields big wand at box office,Final 'Harry Potter' wields big wand at box office,Sony Ericsson counts cost of Japanese disaster,UPDATE 4-Sony Ericsson counts cost of Japanese disaster,RPT-Sony Ericsson makes surprise Q2 loss, hit by Japan,Sony Ericsson makes surprise Q2 loss, hit by Japan
Body: NEW YORK When Joel Klein stepped down from running New York City's schools last year to head the education division at News Corp, he seemed to be trading the glare of government for private sector comforts., NEW YORK, July 15 When Joel Klein stepped downfrom running New York City's schools last year to head theeducation division at News Corp , he seemed to betrading the glare of government for private sector comforts.,LOS ANGELES Harry Potter's final film adventure has bolted to a big start at worldwide box offices, breaking the record for midnight screenings in the U.S. and Canada with $43.5 million and setting the stage for a massive weekend debut., * International box office hits $82.5 million in two days,HELSINKI/STOCKHOLM Mobile phone maker Sony Ericsson forecast an upturn in the second half, as it posted a first quarterly loss since 2009 due to a parts shortage stemming from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan. |¶ÿ, * Q2 pretax loss 42 mln euros, vs forecast profit 4.9 mln, STOCKHOLM, July 15 Mobile phone maker SonyEricsson posted a surprise second quarter loss on Friday andsaid it had been impacted by the earthquake in Japan., STOCKHOLM, July 15 Mobile phone maker SonyEricsson posted a surprise second quarter loss on Friday andsaid it had been impacted by the earthquake in Japan.

Title: Spotify to launch in US after long wait,"Harry Potter" whips up early magic at box offices,'Harry Potter' whips up early magic at box offices,UPDATE 1-India's Tata Consultancy Q1 net profit up 28 pct,Spotify to launch in US after long wait
Body: NEW YORK Spotify, the popular European music service, is set to launch in the United States on Thursday the company said. |¶ÿ,LOS ANGELES Even before its U.S. debut, the new "Harry Potter" movie is conjuring a lot of magic at box offices, taking in $43.6 million overseas on its opening day and sending advance U.S. ticket sales to record levels., LOS ANGELES, July 14 Even before its U.S.debut, the new "Harry Potter" movie is conjuring a lot of magicat box offices, taking in $43.6 million overseas on its openingday and sending advance U.S. ticket sales to record levels., * Q1 net profit 23.8 bln rupees vs 22.9 bln rupees forecast, NEW YORK, July 13 Spotify, the popular Europeanmusic service, is set to launch in the United States onThursday the company said.

Title: Hollywood turns on the starpower for Comic-Con,UPDATE 1-Hollywood turns on the starpower for Comic-Con,"Harry Potter" rings up record $476 million globally,UPDATE 2-'Harry Potter' rings up record $476 mln globally,The top films at the North American box office
Body: LOS ANGELES Heading into this year's giant Comic-Con International pop culture convention in San Diego, media watchers believed Hollywood might play a smaller role because some heavily promoted movies there in 2010 fizzled at box offices., * TV networks show off latest sci-fi, fantasy programs (Adds bullets, refiles to fix typo, paragraph 10),LOS ANGELES The final "Harry Potter" film shattered box office records worldwide with a whopping $168.6 million in U.S. and Canadian ticket sales over the opening weekend and nearly $476 million globally., * 'Midnight in Paris' becomes Woody Allen's top film (Adds global numbers for Harry Potter, other film tallies), LOS ANGELES, July 17 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for weekend beginningon July 15, led by a record-setting debut for "Harry Potter andthe Deathly Hallows -- Part 2," according to studio estimatescompiled on Sunday by Reuters. [ID:nN1E76G049]

Title: Baidu in landmark deal with record labels,UPDATE 5-Baidu in landmark deal with record labels,UPDATE 2-FBI arrests 14 in probe of hacker group Anonymous,Frustrated judge pushes Google digital book deal,FBI raid seeks suspected 'Anonymous' computers,Frustrated judge pushes Google digital book deal,UPDATE 1-InterDigital explores ways to sell patents or company,Hackers breach Murdoch's Sun newspaper website,Hackers breach Murdoch's UK Sun newspaper website
Body: SHANGHAI Baidu Inc, China's largest search engine, has agreed with top music studios to distribute licensed songs through its mp3 search service, ending a legal dispute over accusations the company encouraged piracy., * Pact ends lawsuits between all parties involved in deal, * Action comes after Anoymous claimed big attacks (Recasts with 14 arrests),NEW YORK A Manhattan federal judge set a September 15 deadline for Google Inc, authors and publishers to come up with a legal plan to create the world's largest digital library, expressing frustration that the six-year-old dispute has not been resolved., NEW YORK, July 19 The FBI on Tuesday raidedthree homes in New York for computers suspected of being usedby members of the Internet vigilante hacking group Anonymous,an agency spokesman said., * Judge says imposing deadline could help speed resolution, * Retains Evercore Partners, Barclays Capital as advisers,LONDON Computer hackers broke into the website of Rupert Murdoch's best-selling British tabloid and altered the front page to show a fake report about the media mogul's death., LONDON, July 19 Computer hackers broke into thewebsite of Rupert Murdoch's best-selling British tabloid andaltered the front page of the Sun to show a fake report aboutthe media mogul's death.

Title: Nokia set for fresh smartphone pain,Nokia set for fresh smartphone pain,Competition pushing rates down for cyberinsurance,Competition pushing rates down for cyberinsurance,UPDATE 3-Samsung takes shot at iPad with new Galaxy Tab
Body: HELSINKI Investors braced for more bleak news from smartphone laggard Nokia Oyj on Thursday with the world's largest handset maker likely to post a second-quarter loss and a weak outlook., * Apple, Sony Ericsson saw strong Q2 smartphone market,NEW YORK Rates for cybersecurity insurance edged lower in the last few months despite surging demand, as heavy competition brewed among insurers rushing into the market in search of the next profitable product, insurance brokers Marsh said on Wednesday., NEW YORK, July 20 Rates for cybersecurityinsurance edged lower in the last few months despite surgingdemand, as heavy competition brewed among insurers rushing intothe market in search of the next profitable product, insurancebrokers Marsh said on Wednesday., * Worldwide tablet market set to surge to 70 mln this year

Body: SAN DIEGO Comic book legend Stan Lee on Friday revealed details of his new web-based, digital series "The Seekers," saying it is set in modern times on an Earth in danger of imminent destruction., SAN DIEGO, July 22 Comic book legend Stan Leeon Friday revealed details of his new web-based, digital series"The Seekers," saying it is set in modern times on an Earth indanger of imminent destruction.,NEW YORK/TOKYO One of Sony Corp's insurers has asked a court to declare that it does not have to pay to defend the media and electronics conglomerate from mounting legal claims related to a massive data breach earlier this year., (Changes dateline; adds Sony comment in paragraphs 5, 12),TOKYO Japan's major consumer electronics makers are expected to show April-June earnings collapsed due to the March earthquake, but focus is turning to whether they can meet their forecasts for a swift recovery, given a fragile global economy., TOKYO, July 22     Japan's top electronicsmakers report their earnings for April-June, the periodfollowing the devastating earthquake and tsunami, next week.

Title: Activists come of age at "Oscars" for hackers,Sony considering dropping LCD JV with Samsung: report,Sony considering dropping LCD JV with Samsung Elec -report,Activists come of age at 'Oscars' for hackers,Walmart puts Vudu on its main site to drive use,Walmart puts Vudu on its main site to drive use
Body: BOSTON The computer hacking community is gearing up for its own version of the annual Oscars, with two notorious "hacktivist" groups and industry heavyweight WikiLeaks among those vying for the top award.,SEOUL Sony Corp is considering pulling out of its LCD joint venture with South Korea's Samsung Electronics, a media report said on Wednesday., SEOUL, July 27 Japan's Sony Corp isconsidering pulling out of its LCD joint venture with SouthKorea's Samsung Electronics , a media report said onWednesday., BOSTON, July 26 The computer hacking communityis gearing up for its own version of the annual Oscars, withtwo notorious "hacktivist" groups and industry heavyweightWikiLeaks among those vying for the top award.,CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc is moving its Vudu video streaming and rental service to a place where it can get attract more eyeballs -- the Walmart.com web site -- as the growing service competes for attention with a variety of video services., * Vudu prices movie rentals from $1-$6.99; no contracts

Title: Canon lifts forecast after rapid quake recovery,UPDATE 2-Canon lifts forecast after rapid quake recovery
Body: TOKYO Canon Inc posted better-than-expected quarterly profits and raised its annual forecast after it staged a rapid recovery from supply chain woes sparked by the March 11 earthquake., * Quarterly profit down 30 pct, but higher than expected

Body: WASHINGTON Hackers with the loose-knit group Anonymous said on Friday they had broken into the network of U.S. government contractor Mantech International Corp and posted some NATO-related correspondence online., * Mantech claims top government agencies among its clients,TOKYO Nintendo's shocking profit battered its shares as much as 20 percent, underscoring deep challenges for an iconic brand struggling to win back users flocking to other gadgets., * Shares fall as much as 20 percent; down almost 50 pct thisyear, * Construction equipment jumps, but power systems tumble toloss, * Samsung becomes No.2 smartphone maker after Apple-StrategyAnalytics, SEOUL, July 29 Samsung Electronics Co , the world's top memory chip maker, expected onFriday global shipments of computer memory chips to rise by alow single digit percent in the third quarter and NAND-typeflash memory chips to grow by a high teens percent., SEOUL, July 29 Samsung Electronics' profit,three months to end-June, 2011

Title: "Cowboys" edge "Smurfs" to take weekend box office,'Cowboys' edge 'Smurfs' to take weekend box office,Sony to reform TV segment: report,UPDATE 1-Sony to reform TV segment - Nikkei,UK teen cyber activist bailed without Internet access,UPDATE 1-UK teen cyber activist bailed without Internet access,Teenage activist in UK court on hacking charge
Body: LOS ANGELES Sci-fi western "Cowboys & Aliens" overcame the upstart "Smurfs" to win the weekend box office with $36.4 million in domestic ticket sales, according to final figures released on Monday. |¶ÿ, LOS ANGELES, Aug 1 Sci-fi western "Cowboys &Aliens" overcame the upstart "Smurfs" to win the weekend boxoffice with $36.4 million in domestic ticket sales, accordingto final figures released on Monday.,Sony Corp will devise plans this month to reform its poor-performing television segment and even consider teaming up with other firms, the Nikkei business daily reported., Aug 2 Sony Corp will devise plans thismonth to reform its poor-performing television segment and evenconsider teaming up with other firms, the Nikkei business dailyreported.,LONDON A British teenager charged with hacking offences and believed to be a leading member of the Anonymous and LulzSec online activist groups was released on bail in a London court on Monday on condition he did not use the Internet., * Teen accused of cyberattacks on Sony, Murdoch media group, LONDON, Aug 1 A teenager believed to be aleading member of the Anonymous and LulzSec online activistgroups appeared in a London court on Monday charged with hackingoffences including an attack on Britain's Serious OrganisedCrime Agency.

Body: SEOUL, July 29 Samsung Electronics Co , the world's top memory chipmaker, reported a 2  5 percent fall in quarterly profit as itsflat screen business posted a second consecutive quarterlyloss , overshadowing strong profit growth from handsetsales., Compiled for Reuters by Media Monitors. Reutershas not verified these stories and does not vouch for theiraccuracy.,LONDON Major Hollywood studios won a test case against Britain's largest internet provider in the High Court on Thursday in their fight against online piracy, the Press Association reported.,TOKYO Japan's Nintendo Co Ltd posted its first-ever quarterly operating loss, cut the price of its 3DS handheld game player and slashed its full-year profit forecast far below market expectations, hit by sluggish sales and a strong yen., * Slashes full-year op profit forecast to 35 bln yen, 27year-low, LONDON, July 28 Major Hollywood studios won atest case against Britain's largest internet provider in theHigh Court on Thursday in their fight against online piracy, thePress Association reported.,TOKYO Japan's top consumer electronic firms recovered faster than expected from the March earthquake, keeping their full-year profit forecasts despite a weakening TV market and worries about the outlook for the global economy., * Sony's Q1 profit falls 59 pct to 27.5 bln yen vs mkt fcast15.2 bln, (Corrects Panasonic's operating profit in fifth-last paragraph), LONDON, July 28 Major Hollywood studios won atest case against Britain's largest internet provider in theHigh Court on Thursday in their fight against online piracy, thePress Association reported.

Title: Surprise box office tie for "Cowboys", "Smurfs",UPDATE 1-Surprise box office tie for "Cowboys", "Smurfs",The top films at the North American box office,The top films at the North American box office,"Cowboys & Aliens" ties "Smurfs" for box office lead
Body: LOS ANGELES The tiny blue "Smurfs" battled big-name, big-budget "Cowboys & Aliens" to a surprising tie at the domestic weekend box office with each film ringing up an estimated $36.2 million in ticket sales, according to studio estimates on Sunday. |¶ÿ, LOS ANGELES, July 31 The tiny blue "Smurfs"battled big-name, big-budget "Cowboys & Aliens" to a surprisingtie at the domestic weekend box office with each film ringingup an estimated $36.2 million in ticket sales, according tostudio estimates on Sunday.,LOS ANGELES Following are the top 10 movies at the North American box office for the weekend beginning on July 29, with "Cowboys & Aliens" and "The Smurfs" producing a tie for first place, according to studio estimates compiled on Sunday by Reuters., LOS ANGELES, July 31 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the weekendbeginning on July 29, with "Cowboys & Aliens" and "The Smurfs"producing a tie for first place, according to studio estimatescompiled on Sunday by Reuters., LOS ANGELES, July 31 Sci-fi Western "Cowboys &Aliens" landed in a dead heat with animated family film "TheSmurfs" at the weekend box office with each movie taking inabout $36.2 million in U.S. and Canadian theaters, according tostudio estimates released on Sunday.

Title: Insight: Murdoch's dynastic dream slips from his grasp,Sony: London warehouse fire may affect UK deliveries,UPDATE 2-Sony: London warehouse fire may affect UK deliveries,Sony says fire extinguished at London warehouse,Sony: London warehouse fire may affect delivery in UK,Sony says warehouse in London on fire, no injuries
Body: LONDON It was one of many strange moments in a hearing rich in absurdity. As British lawmakers questioned Rupert Murdoch last month over whether his News of the World journalists broke the law by hacking into mobile phones, the 80-year-old Australian-born boss of media giant News Corporation began to reminiscence about his late father.,TOKYO Sony Corp said on Tuesday deliveries in Britain of compact discs and DVDs could be affected after its sole warehouse for content products in the country caught fire in north London. |¶ÿ, * Enfield building is sole warehouse for UK-bound contentproducts, TOKYO, Aug 9 Sony Corp said on Tuesdaythat a fire at its warehouse in the Enfield neighbourhood ofLondon has been extinguished.		 (Reporting by Nathan Layne; Editing by Joseph Radford), TOKYO, Aug 9 Sony Corp said on Tuesdaythe warehouse that has caught fire in the Enfield neighbourhoodof London is its only warehouse storing DVDs, CDs and othercontent products sold in Britain., TOKYO, Aug 9 Sony Corp said on Tuesdaythat a warehouse in north London has caught fire, damagingcompact disks, DVDs and other content products.

Body: WASHINGTON A congresswoman on Wednesday requested more information on security company McAfee's report detailing a five-year hacking campaign that breached 72 organizations globally., * Asks about hacking campaign's reach into consumers' data,BANGALORE Harman International Industries Inc's  quarterly profit fell sharply and the car audio systems maker said it will reorganize its automotive and consumer businesses to boost profitability., * Shares fall 8 pct to new year-low (Rewrites throughout, adds details, adds share movement)

Title: Sony, LG Electronics settle bitter patent dispute,UPDATE 1-Sony, LG Elec settle bitter patent dispute,LG Elec says has settled patent disputes with Sony
Body: SEOUL/TOKYO LG Electronics and Sony said on Thursday that they have resolved patent disputes between the two firms spanning smartphones, TVs and Blu-ray technology, with LG adding that they have signed a cross-licensing deal., * LG shares outperform market, Sony shares down (Adds background, share moves), SEOUL, Aug 11 LG Electronics said onThursday that it had resolved patent infringement disputes withSony and signed a cross-licensing deal that coveredpatents on TVs, mobile phones, PCs, digital cameras and otherproducts.

Title: UPDATE 1-LG Display plans to invest $2.83 bln in OEL panels - Nikkei,FEATURE-Searching for a new Sony in the rubble of the great quake,Oracle, other companies "punkd" in hacking contest,UPDATE 1-Oracle, other companies 'punkd' in hacking contest
Body: Aug 9 South Korea's LG Display aimsto invest about 220 billion yen ($2.83 billion) towardmass-production of OEL (organic electroluminescence) panels fromthe second half of 2014, the Nikkei business daily reported,quoting a top executive., * Japan ranks low in attitudes towards entrepreneurship,LAS VEGAS A weekend contest at the world's largest hacking convention in Las Vegas showed one reason why big corporations seem to be such easy prey for cyber criminals: their workers are poorly trained in security., * Hackers find employees of many US companies easy prey

Title: Google's bold bet on Motorola could hit Asian handset makers,Eyes on holiday season, casual games at Gamescom,Eyes on holiday season, casual games at Gamescom,Electronic Arts upbeat about holiday season sales
Body: SEOUL, Aug 16 Asian handset vendors such as HTC and Samsung Electronics could facepressure after Google Inc swooped in to buy MotorolaMobility Holdings Inc for $12.5 billion to help protectits fast-growing Android mobile operating system.,FRANKFURT Hackers, holiday season sales and "casual" gaming are expected to be in the spotlight at Gamescom, Europe's biggest video game trade fair, which throws its doors open to visitors this week., * All eyes on Sony for possible PlayStation 3 price cut,FRANKFURT, Aug 15 Video games publisher Electronic Arts (EA) is upbeat about Christmas holiday sales as it expects to release top titles and prepares its most high profile launch ever: "Star Wars: The Old Republic".

Body: NEW YORK/TORONTO BlackBerry maker Research In Motion is close to rolling out its own music streaming service that will work across its mobile devices, according to four people familiar with the plans., * Music could be integrated into Messenger - source (Adds RIM declines comment, analyst comment, share price; inU.S. dollars unless noted),NEW YORK GameStop Corp  said its growth this year will be driven by a strong holiday lineup and customers buying used games to save money, which sent its shares higher after an initial drop on Thursday., * Shares rise more nearly 5 percent (Adds executive comments, details on used games business), NEW YORK/TORONTO, Aug 18 BlackBerry makerResearch In Motion Ltd  is close to rolling out its ownmusic streaming service that will work across its mobiledevices, according to three people familiar with its plans.,SEOUL South Korea's LG Electronics Inc has cut its annual television sales forecast by 20 percent, a media report said, joining its Japanese rival Sony Corp in bracing for weaker sales due to uncertain global economic prospects., * LG cuts flat-screen TV sales target to 32 mln units-report

Title: Sony reduces PlayStation price to revive sales,UPDATE 3-Sony reduces PlayStation price to revive sales,CORRECTED-UPDATE1-Sony slashes PlayStation price to revive sales
Body: COLOGNE, Germany/NEW YORK Sony Corp has cut the price of its basic PlayStation 3 gaming console by nearly a fifth in the United States, a move that could lift the industry by boosting video game sales ahead of the holiday season., * New PSP coming later this year in Europe (Adds executive comments, share prices for Sony and GameStop,byline), (Corrects last word in second paragraph to read "gear" insteadof "fear")

Body: * Could herald Bronfman's eventual exit (Adds background on Bronfman's role),COLOGNE, Germany German video game consumers unfazed by the threat of economic uncertainty look happy to spend their hard-earned euros on the latest new games as a strong economic performance buoys Europe's biggest economy., COLOGNE, Germany, Aug 19 German video gameconsumers appear unfazed by global economic uncertainty and areboosting spending on the latest new games.,NEW YORK/TORONTO BlackBerry maker Research In Motion is close to rolling out its own music streaming service that will work across its mobile devices, according to four people familiar with the plans.

Title: "The Help" outflexes "Conan" to win box office,UPDATE 1-'The Help' outflexes 'Conan' to win box office,The top films at the North American box office,'The Help' beats four new films to win box office
Body: LOS ANGELES The maids of "The Help" proved far mightier than muscle-flexing "Conan the Barbarian" and three other new releases at the weekend box office, taking the top spot with an estimated $20.5 million in U.S. and Canadian ticket sales., * 'Apes' hangs on at No. 2(Adds details on top five films, quotes), LOS ANGELES, Aug 21 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the weekendbeginning on Aug. 19, with Southern society drama "The Help" inthe No. 1 spot, according to studio estimates compiled onSunday by Reuters., LOS ANGELES, Aug 21 Southern society drama "TheHelp" overtook four new releases to take the top spot at thedomestic weekend box office, according to studio estimatescompiled by Reuters on Sunday.

Title: Box office heading toward record despite economy,Box office heading toward record despite economy,RPT-GLOBAL MARKETS-Euro wobbles after summit let-down; Asia techs down,Sony shares open down in Tokyo after PS3 price cut
Body: LOS ANGELES A popular boy wizard, comic-book heroes and some foul-mouthed women are leading Hollywood toward a record-breaking summer despite the sour economy and high unemployment resulting in tightened consumer spending. |¶ÿ,   * Sour economy, high unemployment not hurting Hollywood, * Euro falls vs dollar after Franco-German talks disappoint, TOKYO, Aug 17 Shares of Sony Corp fell1.5 percent in early morning trade in Tokyo after the companycut the price of its basic PlayStation 3 gaming console to boostsales.

Title: When a slimmer iPhone just isn't good enough,Google's Schmidt sees more partners for Google TV,Google's Schmidt sees more partners for Google TV
Body: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Tim Cook has big shoes to fill and he can't do it by just pushing out snazzier versions of the iPhone or iPad. |¶ÿ,EDINBURGH, Scotland Google is "absolutely committed" to its fledgling television business and expects many more partners to join it soon, Executive Chairman Eric Schmidt said on Saturday., EDINBURGH, Scotland, Aug 27 Google is"absolutely committed" to its fledgling television business andexpects many more partners to join it soon, Executive ChairmanEric Schmidt said on Saturday.

Title: Analysis: When a slimmer iPhone just isn't good enough,OmniVision sinks on fears of losing business at Apple,Analysis: History shows iconic CEOs tough act to follow,Google chairman Schmidt to woo TV elite,Insight: Jobs exit opens door for nimble Apple rivals
Body: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Tim Cook has big shoes to fill and he can't do it by just pushing out snazzier versions of the iPhone or iPad. |¶ÿ,Shares of OmniVision Technologies Inc  lost over a quarter of their value in pre-market trading, a day after the camera sensor maker forecast a weak second quarter, raising fears that it is losing business at top customer Apple Inc .,SEATTLE How does a company recover from the loss of an iconic leader like Steve Jobs at Apple Inc ?, * TV industry seeking clues to impact of Google's Motoroladeal,SAN FRANCISCO/SEOUL The changing of the guard at Apple Inc gives rivals from Google Inc to Microsoft Corp and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd an unprecedented opportunity to take on the consumer electronics powerhouse. |¶ÿ

Title: INSIGHT-UPDATE 4-Jobs exit opens door for nimble Apple rivals,OmniVision sees Q2 below estimates, shares dive,Insight: Jobs exit opens door for nimble Apple rivals,Apple fans pay tribute to "industry icon" Jobs,UPDATE 3-Apple fans pay tribute to "industry icon" Jobs,.,.,RIM unveils new cloud-based music service,UPDATE 1-RIM unveils new cloud-based music service
Body: * All battling for supremacy in booming smartphone market (Adds analyst and executive comments, background),BANGALORE OmniVision Technologies Inc  forecast second-quarter results well below estimates, hinting at a loss of market share in its key smartphone image sensor business, sending its shares down 25 percent in extended trade.,SEOUL The resignation of Apple Inc CEO Steve Jobs opens the door for rivals Samsung Electronics and HTC to battle for smartphone supremacy in salesrooms and courtrooms globally. |¶ÿ,SAN FRANCISCO/SHANGHAI (Reuters)- From San Francisco to Seoul to Sydney, fans of Apple Inc paid tribute to Steve Jobs after he resigned as CEO, calling him an icon for the entire technology industry, not just the company he co-founded., SAN FRANCISCO/SHANGHAI, Aug 25 (Reuters)- From San Franciscoto Seoul to Sydney, fans of Apple Inc paid tribute toSteve Jobs after he resigned as CEO, calling him an icon for theentire technology industry, not just the company he co-founded.,.	,.	,Canada's Research In Motion Ltd will unveil a new cloud-based social music sharing service called BBM Music, as companies begin to bet on entertainment delivered over the Internet that incorporates social networking features., Aug 25 Canada's Research In Motion Ltd will unveil a new cloud-based social music sharing servicecalled BBM Music, as companies begin to bet on entertainmentdelivered over the Internet that incorporates social networkingfeatures.

Title: "The Help" holds on at top of storm-hit box office,UPDATE 1-'The Help' holds on at top of storm-hit box office,The top films at the North American box office,'The Help' shines again at top of box office,Analysis: When a slimmer iPhone just isn't good enough
Body: LOS ANGELES The hard-working maids of "The Help" hung on to the top of a storm-battered box office over the weekend and beat a trio of new releases with $14.3 million in domestic ticket sales, studio estimates released on Sunday showed., * "Apes" global total now tops $300 mln (Adds details on other films, comments), LOS ANGELES, Aug 28 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the weekendbeginning on Aug. 26, with Southern drama "The Help" in the No.1 spot, according to studio estimates compiled on Sunday byReuters., LOS ANGELES, Aug 28 The hard-working maids of"The Help" beat three new releases to win the North Americanbox office on a weekend dampened by Hurricane Irene, accordingto studio estimates released on Sunday.,NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Tim Cook has big shoes to fill and he can't do it by just pushing out snazzier versions of the iPhone or iPad. |¶ÿ

Title: Nikkei set to open higher on U.S. easing hopes,Sony tablets fail to impress on price, hardware,UPDATE 4-Sony tablets fail to impress on price, hardware,Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions,Sony's tablets may be a tough sell with price tag,UPDATE 1-Sony joins crowded tablet market with 2 devices,Japan backs Sony, Toshiba, Hitachi LCD merger,UPDATE 3-Japan backs Sony, Toshiba, Hitachi LCD merger,Sony sets date for mobile 3D headset Japan launch,Sony sets date for mobile 3D headset Japan launch
Body: TOKYO, Sept 1 Japan's Nikkei stock average isset to rise on Thursday, tracking U.S. gains on hopes for moreeasing by the Federal Reserve, but the upside will be limited bycaution ahead of Chinese data in the morning session as well asthis week's U.S. data.,NEW YORK/BERLIN Sony's hopes of dominating consumer electronics once again with its new tablets suffered a crushing blow on Wednesday from analysts and gadget reviewers whose first impressions were overwhelmingly bad., * Analysts concerned high price will turn off consumers, Aug 31 The following bids, mergers, acquisitionsand disposals involving European, U.S. and Asian companies werereported by 1400 GMT on Wednesday:,NEW YORK/BERLIN Sony Corp  took the wraps off its long-awaited tablets on Wednesday with price tags that could hurt the company's chances to compete for the No. 2 spot in the tablet market., * Single-screen S tablet costs $499 and $599, same as iPad,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp, Toshiba Corp and Hitachi Ltd will merge their liquid-crystal display operations using $2.6 billion of government-backed funds to fend off growing competition from rivals in South Korea and Taiwan., * Fund could come under fire over biggest ever investment,TOKYO Spider-Man leaps from the top of a building and swings out towards you, cloak fluttering so close you can almost touch it -- at work, on a train, in a car, or wherever you are.,TOKYO Spider-Man leaps from the top of a building and swings out toward you, cloak fluttering so close you can almost touch it -- at work, on a train, in a car, or wherever you are.

Title: Netflix shares fall after stumble with Starz,UPDATE 4-Netflix shares fall after stumble with Starz,Microsoft to win from Google Motorola buy -Acer,IFA-TV makers hope for boost in H2,Sony tablets face tough sell on price, hardware,Starz to pull content from Netflix as talks fail,UPDATE 4-Starz to pull content from Netflix as talks fail
Body: LOS ANGELES/BANGALORE High-flying Netflix Inc saw its shares fall 8.6 percent on Friday after failing to secure a chunk of movie content for the online service it touts as the future of its popular video rental business., * Shares drop 8.6 pct to $213.11 after Starz deal collapse, BERLIN, Sept 2 Microsoft will be thewinner in Google's acquisition of Motorola Mobility as the deal makes Google a direct rival to itsphone-making clients, a senior executive from Acer Inc said on Friday., BERLIN, Sept 2 TV makers put on a brave face atIFA, Europe's biggest consumer electronics show in Berlin,reassuring themselves that new products and brisk holidaybusiness would compensate a weak first six months of the year.,TOKYO/NEW YORK Sony's new tablet computers failed to excite gadget reviewers and analysts who criticized the pricing and quality of the devices, underscoring the battle Sony faces regaining its consumer electronics crown. |¶ÿ,LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK Starz Entertainment will pull all of its movies and television shows from Netflix Inc's streaming service early next year, depriving Netflix customers from online viewing of new releases out of two major Hollywood studios., * Netflix shares fall 8.7 pct after-hours (Adds details on negotiations)

Title: Applied Materials sees weak solar sales adding to PC woes,ADR Report-Japan weighs on foreign shares on ratings move,UPDATE 1-Applied Materials Q3 sales rises 11 pct
Body: BANGALORE Applied Materials warned that fourth-quarter revenue could fall as much as 30 percent, hurt by plummeting microchip and solar-cell demand, joining a growing list of U.S. companies hammered by a widening economic slowdown., NEW YORK, Aug 24 U.S.-traded shares of overseascompanies fell on Wednesday, weighed down by Asian stocks aslocal markets slipped., Aug 24 Chip-manufacturing equipment makerApplied Materials posted an 11 percent rise inquarterly sales.

Title: UPDATE 1-'The Help' wins box office, summer hits record,The top films at the North American box office,'The Help' wins holiday weekend box office,BRIEF-Moody's: Struggling joint ventures could impact sponsors' financial flexibility
Body: * Summer sales break Hollywood record (Adds details on top five films, summer sales totals), LOS ANGELES, Sept 5 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the four days overthe U.S. holiday weekend beginning on Sept. 2, with civilrights-era drama "The Help" in the No. 1 spot, according tostudio estimates compiled on Monday by Reuters., LOS ANGELES, Sept 5 The housekeepers of "TheHelp" kept their hold on the top of the domestic box office bybeating three new releases over the U.S. holiday weekend,according to studio estimates released on Monday., * Moody's: Cash-consuming joint ventures could impactsponsors' financial flexibility

Title: Sony recruits information security boss after hacking,Sony recruits information security boss after hacking
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp picked a former official at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security for the new post of chief information security officer, months after a massive hacking attack leaked information on 100 million user accounts on its games networks., TOKYO, Sept 6 Sony Corp picked a formerofficial at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security for the newpost of chief information security officer, months after amassive hacking attack leaked information on 100 million useraccounts on its games networks.

Title: Artists set to win European music copyright battle,Artists set to win European music copyright battle,Artists set to win European music copyright battle,UPDATE 2-Nikon shares jump on report of mirrorless camera
Body: BRUSSELS/LONDON Musicians are likely to win longer copyright protection of their work in Europe next week, helping artists and record labels as music revenues decline, and bringing Europe closer into line with the United States.,BRUSSELS/LONDON Musicians are likely to win longer copyright protection of their work in Europe next week, helping artists and record labels as music revenues decline, and bringing Europe closer into line with the United States., BRUSSELS/LONDON, Sept 9 Musicians are likely towin longer copyright protection of their work in Europe nextweek, helping artists and record labels as music revenuesdecline, and bringing Europe closer into line with the UnitedStates., TOKYO, Sept 9 Shares in Nikon Corp rosefor the third straight day on Friday, after market speculationabout the company's launch of its first mirrorless camera wasboosted by a report in the Nikkei newspaper that the new productwould be on the market by the end of the year.

Title: Starz to pull content from Netflix as talks fail,UPDATE 3-Starz to pull content from Netflix as talks fail,Starz, Netflix fail to reach renewal deal,Android vendors unfazed by Google-Motorola deal,UPDATE 1-Android vendors unfazed by Google-Motorola deal,Sony tablets face tough sell on price, hardware,Google bought Motorola to guard Android: Sony Ericsson,PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business news - Sept 1,UPDATE 5-Sony tablets face tough sell on price, hardware
Body: LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK Starz Entertainment will pull its movies and television shows from Netflix Inc's streaming service early next year, depriving Netflix customers of online access to new releases from two major Hollywood studios., * Netflix shares fall 8.7 pct after-hours (Adds Netflix, analyst comment, updates shares),LOS ANGELES Starz Entertainment will pull its movies and shows from Netflix Inc's  popular video streaming service by next February after renewal talks failed.,BERLIN Smartphone vendors using Google's Android platform are unfazed by the Web giant's acquisition of Motorola Mobility, seeing it as a move to protect the software from legal attacks and not a competitive threat in the marketplace., * Not seen as competitive threat to fellow Android users (Adds HTC, Acer comments),TOKYO/NEW YORK Sony's new tablet computers failed to excite gadget reviewers and analysts who criticized the pricing and quality of the devices, underscoring the battle Sony faces regaining its consumer electronics crown. |¶ÿ,BERLIN Smartphone vendor Sony Ericsson said it saw Google's acquisition of rival Motorola Mobility as a move to protect Google's Android software from legal attacks by rivals., Sept 1 The following were the top stories in TheNew York Times business pages on Thursday. Reuters has notverified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy., (Adds detail, comment from Tokyo launch; changes dateline,byline)

Title: "Contagion" catches box office lead,UPDATE 1-'Contagion' catches box office lead,The top films at the North American box office,'Contagion' takes hold of weekend box office
Body: LOS ANGELES "Contagion" gripped filmgoers as the thriller about the race to contain a deadly virus took hold of the top spot at the domestic box office and knocked hit drama "The Help" to second place. |¶ÿ, * New drama 'Warrior' third, 'Bucky Larson' bombs (Adds details on top 5 films, quotes), LOS ANGELES, Sept 11 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the weekendbeginning on Sept. 9, with thriller "Contagion" in the No. 1spot, according to studio estimates compiled on Sunday byReuters., LOS ANGELES, Sept 11 Deadly virus thriller"Contagion" caught on with filmgoers and easily took the topspot at the weekend box office in the United States and Canada,according to studio estimates compiled by Reuters on Sunday.

Title: DirecTV streams NFL games for added sales,DirecTV streams NFL games for added sales
Body: NEW YORK DirecTV is expanding its NFL Sunday Ticket television package, which lets viewers watch football outside their local markets, to see if it can make some extra money from broadcasting the games on the Internet., * Streaming-only NFL option could be new revenue source

Title: Netflix to combat piracy as it expands into Latam,Exclusive: Simon Fuller bids for publisher Bug Music,Simon Fuller bids for LA music publisher Bug Music
Body: BUENOS AIRES Netflix will fight piracy with quality content that people would pay for, while expanding its online streaming service to Latin America and the Caribbean, the company's chief executive said on Wednesday.,NEW YORK American Idol creator Simon Fuller is among parties in the final stages of bidding for Los Angeles music publisher Bug Music, according to three people familiar with the process., NEW YORK, Sept 7 Pop Idol and American Idolcreator Simon Fuller is among the parties in the final stagesof bidding for Los Angeles music publisher Bug Music, accordingto a person familiar with the process.

Title: Artists welcome EU music copyright extension,Artists welcome EU music copyright extension,UPDATE 1-Tokyo Game Show to highlight rise of social games,Tokyo Game Show to highlight rise of social games
Body: LONDON Artists welcomed a European decision to extend copyright for recorded music to 70 from 50 years, after a years-long campaign by performers including Paul McCartney and Cliff Richard who faced their rights expiring in their lifetime., LONDON, Sept 12 Artists welcomed a Europeandecision to extend copyright for recorded music to 70 from 50years, after a years-long campaign by performers including PaulMcCartney and Cliff Richard who faced their rights expiring intheir lifetime., * Nintendo to struggle to revive 3DS interest at Sept. 13event, * Nintendo to struggle to revive 3DS interest at Sept. 13event

Title: "The Help" hangs on to box office crown,'The Help' hangs on to box office crown
Body: LOS ANGELES Surprise summer hit "The Help" retained the No. 1 spot at movie theater box offices on Sunday, beating back three newcomers and appearing headed for victory over a long U.S. holiday weekend. |¶ÿ, LOS ANGELES, Sept 4 Surprise summer hit "TheHelp" retained the No. 1 spot at movie theater box offices onSunday, beating back three newcomers and appearing headed forvictory over a long U.S. holiday weekend.

Title: Sony to start PS Vita global rollout in Japan on December 17,UPDATE 1-Sony to start PS Vita global rollout in Japan on Dec. 17,Sony says to launch new handheld on Dec 17 in Japan
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp will launch its new PlayStation Vita handheld games device on December 17 in Japan, kicking off a global rollout, and insisted it will not reduce the price in the face of discounting by rival Nintendo. |¶ÿ, * Sony to launch 26 software titles on Dec. 17 (Adds details, background), TOKYO, Sept 14 Sony Corp will launchits new PlayStation Vita handheld games device on Dec. 17 inJapan, and will not discount the price, the head of its Japanesegames unit said on Wednesday.

Body: LOS ANGELES "The Lion King" fended off Brad Pitt to keep the box-office crown for a second straight weekend., * Worldwide sales near $78 mln for 'Lion King' re-release, LOS ANGELES, Sept 25 Following are the top 10movies at the North American box office for the weekendbeginning on Sept. 23, with "The Lion King 3D" in the No. 1spot, according to studio estimates compiled on Sunday byReuters., LOS ANGELES, Sept 25 Walt Disney Co's "The Lion King 3D" ruled the movie box office for the secondstraight weekend, beating baseball drama "Moneyball" and familyfilm "Dolphin Tale."

Title: Suspected LulzSec hacker arrested in Sony studio breach
Body: LOS ANGELES A suspected member of the clandestine hacking group LulzSec was arrested in Arizona on Thursday on charges of taking part in an extensive computer breach of the Sony Pictures Entertainment film studio, the FBI said.

Title: Could one music downloader change U.S. copyright law?,Sony buys U.S. diagnostic device firm Micronics Inc
Body: NEW YORK In the age of iTunes and an-app-for-everything, Joel Tenenbaum's battle with the music industry over illegal downloading seems as relevant as an eight-track cassette., TOKYO, Sept 28 Sony Corp said onWednesday it had bought U.S.-based Micronics Inc, a developer ofdiagnostics equipment, in a bid to accelerate its own researchand development and speed the commercialisation of point-of-carediagnostics devices.

Title: Brazil, FIFA to meet Monday on legal dispute-paper
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct 1 Brazilian President DilmaRousseff plans to meet the president of soccer's worldgoverning body on Monday to resolve a legal dispute over the2014 World Cup, the Estado de S. Paulo newspaper reported.

Body: A joint venture of Hitachi Ltd and LG Electronics Inc has agreed to plead guilty and pay a $21.1 million fine for bid-rigging and price-fixing in the sale of optical disk drives, the Justice Department said on Friday.,   * Involves optical disk drive sales dating back to 2004, TOKYO, Sept 30 KDDI , Japan'ssecond-largest mobile carrier, said on Friday it would replacelithium ion battery packs on two million mobile phones free ofcharge after a series of overheating incidents, one of whichresulted in a slight injury., TOKYO, Sept 30 KDDI , Japan'ssecond-largest mobile carrier, said on Friday it would replacelithium ion battery packs on 2 million mobile phones free ofcharge after overheating problems that slightly injured oneindividual.

Body: IBM Corp  will buy security software provider Q1 Labs as it looks to expand in a market which has seen recent high-profile cyber attacks on victims from Sony Corp  to the British police., * Security software & services is a $94 bln marketopportunity - IBM,International Business Machines Corp (IBM) said it is to buy Q1 Labs, a privately-held security intelligence software provider, as it looks to tap into a growing market for security software.,TOKYO Japanese electronics firms are suffering from the downturn in European consumption and the euro's slump to a 10-year low against the yen, senior executives from Sony Corp, Panasonic Corp and Fujitsu Ltd said on Tuesday.,  , TOKYO, Oct 4 Sony Corp , wants toincrease parts procurement from the euro zone to help ease theimpact on profits from a gain in the yen against the commonEuropean currency, the consumer electronic company's deputypresident said.

Title: S&P cuts Sony rating, warns of further downgrade,UPDATE 1-S&P cuts Sony rating, warns of further downgrade,S&P cuts Sony rating to BBB+, outlook negative
Body: TOKYO Standard and Poor's cut its long-term debt rating on Sony Corp on Wednesday to BBB+, warning it may drop the consumer electronics giant a further notch within a year unless it shows it can achieve a significant turnaround in profitability.,* S&P says Sony hobbled by costs, price erosion, competition,TOKYO, Feb 8 Credit rating agency Standardand Poor's cut its debt rating on Sony Corp byone-notch on Wednesday to BBB+, with a negative outlook, sayingthe company faces more difficulties in recovering profitability.

Title: Sony returns to smartphones with new models
Body: BARCELONA Sony Corp. declared a return to the smartphone business on Sunday, unveiling its first smartphones under the Sony brand, but warned the group's painful transition would not be as fast as rebranding.

Title: Sony-led group seeks EU go-ahead to buy EMI publishing
Body: BRUSSELS, Feb 28 A group led by Japan'sSony is seeking EU regulatory approval to buyLondon-based record label EMI's music publishing business in amove that would see it become the biggest player in the sector,the European Commission said on Tuesday.

Title: EU regulators assessing EMI deal impact on rivals, prices
Body: BRUSSELS, Feb 29 EU antitrust regulatorsare asking rivals and users whether plans by Vivendi's Universal Music and a Sony-led group to acquire partsof record label EMI will result in higher prices and also shutout competitors.

Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  is cutting 10,000 jobs, about 6 percent of its global workforce, the Nikkei newspaper reported on Monday, as new CEO Kazuo Hirai looks to steer the electronics and entertainment giant back to profit after four years in the red.,TOKYO, April 9 Japan's Sony Corp is tocut 10,000 jobs, about 6 percent of its workforce, the Nikkeinewspaper reported on Monday, as new CEO Kazuo Hirai looks tosteer the electronics and entertainment giant back to profitafter four years in the red.,TOKYO, April 9 Sony will cut its globalworkforce by about 10,000, or 6 percent of its entire workforce,by as early as the end of 2012, the Nikkei newspaper reported onMonday.

Body: TOKYO Less than a fortnight into his job as CEO, Kazuo Hirai sketched out a strategy to revive Sony Corp: a major push into smartphones, growth in games and cameras, and big cost cuts in a TV business that has not made a profit in eight years. |¶ÿ,TOKYO, April 12 Less than a fortnight into hisjob as CEO, Kazuo Hirai sketched out a strategy to revive SonyCorp : a major push into smartphones, growth in gamesand cameras, and big cost cuts in a TV business that has notmade a profit in 8 years.,* Nikkei ends 7-session losing run    * Sony gains ahead of turnaround plan    * Hitachi Construction up on report to post stronger results    By Sophie Knight and Mari Saito	    TOKYO, April 12 Japan's Nikkei average broke aseven-session losing streak on Thursday, boosted by bigprogramme buying by hedge funds, which pushed the index to above9,500, triggering short covering and accelerating the movehigher, market participants said.	    The Nikkei closed 0.7 percent higher a,TOKYO, April 12 Sony Corp will explorealliances in batteries for electric vehicles and aims to be aleading player in the global mobile phone market, its new chiefexecutive said on Thursday.,TOKYO, April 12 Sony Corp said onThursday it would cut about 10,000 jobs worldwide this businessyear as the electronics giant aims to come out of its deeplosses, dragged down by its ailing TV unit.,TOKYO, April 12 Sony Corp said onThursday it would cut about 10,000 jobs worldwide this businessyear as the electronics giant aims to come out of its deeplosses, dragged down by its ailing TV unit.,TOKYO Kazuo Hirai's brief honeymoon as Sony Corp's new chief has ended abruptly as the struggling electronics giant doubled its annual loss forecast, sending its shares tumbling. |¶ÿ

Title: Sony sees record $6.4 billion loss on tax hit,Equity finance an option, but no plans: Sony CFO,UPDATE 6-Sony sees record $6.4 bln loss on tax hit,Sony jobs cull hit Sweden R&D centre in March,Sony put on watch for downgrade by Japan rating agency R&I,Sony CFO: Equity finance an option, but no plans,CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Sony sees record $6.4 bln net loss, to take tax hit,REFILE-Sony sees record $6.4 bln net loss, double earlier estimate
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp flagged a record $6.4 billion annual net loss, double an earlier forecast and a fourth straight year of red ink, as it writes off deferred tax credits, heaping more pressure on its new CEO to turn around the electronics giant. |¶ÿ,TOKYO Sony Corp Chief Financial Officer Masaru Kato told a news briefing on Tuesday that equity finance is an option for the consumer electronics firm, but it has no current plans to raise capital.,* Sees record 520 bln yen net loss in year to end-March 2012,STOCKHOLM, April 10 Workers at Sony Corp's mobile phone research facilities in Sweden learned inlate March that 6 percent of them were to  lose their jobs, aratio that is in line with media reports of a worldwide job cutsplan by the Japanese electronics group.,TOKYO, April 10 Japanese rating agency R&I putSony Corp on watch for a ratings downgrade on Tuesday,citing concerns that the money losing electronics firm couldtake more time to improve revenue.,TOKYO, April 10 Sony Corp ChiefFinancial Officer Masaru Kato told a news briefing on Tuesdaythat equity finance is an option for the consumer electronicsfirm, but it has no current plans to raise capital.,TOKYO, April 10 Sony Corp forecast arecord $6.4 billion net loss for the business year just ended,double earlier forecasts and a fourth straight year of losses,inflated by writing off deferred tax assets in the UnitedStates.,TOKYO, April 10 Sony Corp. said onTuesday it will post a record net loss for the year that endedMarch 31 of 520 billion yen ($6.4 billion), more than double aFebruary forecast as a result of additional tax expenses.

Body: TOKYO Shares in Japan's consumer electronics giant Sony Corp  slipped quietly to a quarter century low this week, a sign of how the Walkman and PlayStation maker has lost its innovative edge and fallen far behind rivals Apple  and Samsung Electronics .,TOKYO, May 10 Shares in Japan's consumerelectronics giant Sony Corp slipped quietly to aquarter century low this week, a sign of how the Walkman andPlayStation maker has lost its innovative edge and fallen farbehind rivals Apple and Samsung Electronics.

Title: Sony slides to three-decade low on strategy doubts,Nikkei in 6th week of losses, Sony slides after results
Body: TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp slumped more than 7 percent to near 32-year lows, as investors doubted the Japanese consumer electronics giant has a strategy to fix its loss-making TV business and compete in the smartphone market against Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics. |¶ÿ,* Sony hits 32-year low as earnings outlook disappoints    * Nikon, Konica Minolta, Hitachi rise after earnings    * Overall tone of market still very bearish    * China industrial data, strong yen, euro zone weigh    By Sophie Knight	    TOKYO, May 11 The Nikkei share average sankbelow 9,000 o n Friday for a sixth straight week of losses, witha choppy earnings season seeing Sony Corp tumbling to a32-year-low but camera maker Nikon Corp and otherssurging on strong guidance.

Title: Sony, Panasonic in talks to make OLED TVs: sources,UPDATE 4-Sony, Panasonic in talks to make OLED TVs - sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp and Panasonic Corp are in talks to develop the technology to mass produce next-generation OLED televisions, sources close to the matter said on Tuesday, but may already be running to catch up with South Korean rivals in a technology widely seen replacing current LCD TVs.,* Sony still in talks with Taiwan's AU Optronics - sources

Title: BRIEF-Moody's:Sony's fiscal 2012 results in line with expectations
Body: May 16 Moody's Japan K.K. said that SonyCorporation's (Baa1, negative) FYE03/2012 results were in linewith Moody's expectations.

Title: Wi-Lan says court rules in its favor in patent case,UPDATE 1-Wi-Lan says court rules in its favor in patent case
Body: Patent licensing company Wi-Lan Inc  said a U.S. judge had ruled in its favor in a patent infringement claim related to handset products and high-speed packet access base stations.,May 17 Patent licensing company Wi-Lan Inc said a U.S. judge had ruled in its favor in a patentinfringement claim related to   handset products and high-speedpacket access base stations.

Title: UPDATE 2-Sharp to supply technology to Hon Hai's China plant -Nikkei,Sony, Sharp say to dissolve LCD joint venture
Body: * Sharp's stake in LCD plant subsidiary to fall to 37.6 pct (Adds detail on LCD plant stake),TOKYO, May 24 Sony Corp said onThursday it will dissolve its joint venture business with SharpCorp to manufacture and distribute large liquid crystalpanels and modules and sell its remaining 7.04 percent stake toSharp Display Products.

Body: TOKYO Sony Corp predicted a return to profit this year as it looks to halve the losses in its TV business that pushed the Japanese consumer electronics giant to a record loss of $5.74 billion in the year just ended.,TOKYO Japanese consumer electronics giant Sony Corp posted a record net loss of 457 billion yen ($5.7 billion) for the year just ended, hit by losses from its TV business, but forecast a return to profit at an operating level in the current year.,* Sees 2012/13 op profit of 180 bln yen vs 173 bln yenconsensus,* Sees 2012/13 op profit of 180 bln yen vs 173 bln yenconsensus,TOKYO, May 10 Sony Corp on Thursdayforecast that sales of its VITA/PSP handheld console would morethan double to 16 million units in the fiscal year ending March2013 from the year before.,* Sees 2012/13 op profit of 180 bln yen vs 173 bln yenconsensus,TOKYO, May 10 Japanese consumer electronicsgiant Sony Corp posted a record net loss of 456.7billion yen ($5.74 billion) for the year just ended, hit bylosses from its TV business, but forecast a return to profit atan operating level in the current year.,May 10 Sony Corp annonce:	 * Une perte d'exploitation de Y67,28 milliards sur l'exercice2011-2012	 * PrÇ¸voir un bÇ¸nÇ¸fice net de Y30 milliards en 2012-2013	 * Une perte nette de Y456 milliards en 2011-2012	 * PrÇ¸voir un bÇ¸nÇ¸fice d'exploitation de Y180 milliards en2012-2013

Title: UPDATE 3-Olympus to cut 2,500 jobs, sell equity stake - media,Sony, Panasonic top candidates for Olympus tie-up: Asahi,Olympus shares jump on report to shore up finances
Body: * Sony & Panasonic leading candidates for equity stake -Asahi,TOKYO Japanese electronics firms Sony Corp and Panasonic Corp are the leading contenders to take an equity stake in Japan's scandal-hit Olympus Corp , the Asahi Shimbun said on Wednesday in a report that sent Olympus shares surging.,TOKYO Shares of Olympus Corp  jumped 7.1 percent on Wednesday after the Asahi newspaper said Sony Corp  and Panasonic Corp  are the leading contenders to take an equity stake in the scandal-hit firm, which is trying to shore up its finances.

Title: "Men in Black' sequel topples 'Avengers' at box office
Body: LOS ANGELES, May 28 "Men in Black 3," the latestinstallment of Sony's alien comedy, zapped three-time champ "TheAvengers," toppling it from the top of movie box office chartsover the Memorial Day holiday weekend, studio estimates releasedon Sunday showed.

Title: Nintendo unveils Miiverse social network for new Wii
Body: TOKYO/LOS ANGELES Japan's Nintendo said it will launch a social and content network dubbed Miiverse for its new Wii U games console, as it plays catch-up with rivals such as Sony and hopes an online strategy will bolster hardware sales in an industry under fire from smartphones and tablets.

Title: New Sony CEO earns pay cut as well as promotion,Sony to launch white Vita with Assassin Creed III software,RPT-Sony to launch white Vita with Assassin Creed III software,Sony to launch white Vita with Assassin Creed III software
Body: TOKYO, June 5 Sony Corp CEO Kazuo Hirai willearn less this year despite his elevation in April from deputyto the top post, after the once stellar consumer electronicscompany posted a record loss and its fourth straight annualdeficit.,LOS ANGELES Sony Corp will launch a white version of its Vita handheld games console in October and market it with the Assassin's Creed III games software from Ubisoft Entertainment in a bid to lure gamers to the machine it launched last year.,LOS ANGELES, June 4 Sony Corp willlaunch a white version of its Vita handheld games console inOctober and market it with the Assassin's Creed III gamessoftware from Ubisoft Entertainment in a bid to luregamers to the machine it launched last year.,LOS ANGELES, June 4 Sony Corp willlaunch a white version of its Vita handheld games console inOctober and market it with the Assassin's Creed III gamessoftware from Ubisoft Entertainment in a bid to luregamers to the machine it launched last year.

Title: Maggert, Merrick stand out from St. Jude crowd
Body: John Merrick bogeyed the 18th hole to fall into a tie with fellow American Jeff Maggert for the lead after Thursday's opening round of the St. Jude Classic at TPC Southwind in Memphis, Tennessee.

Title: Sony to invest $997 million to boost output of CMOS sensors,UPDATE 1-Sony to invest $997 mln to boost output of CMOS sensors,Sony to invest $997 mln to boost output capacity of CMOS sensors,Global growth fears weigh on Japan's Nikkei,Nikkei falls 0.9 pct on slowing global growth fears,Olympus in final talks with Sony for capital-Nikkei,UPDATE 2-Olympus in final talks with Sony for capital-Nikkei,Sony, Panasonic to announce OLED tie-up next week: sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Friday it would spend 80 billion yen ($997 million) to boost production of image sensors as part of its strategy to boost income from digital imaging.,TOKYO, June 22 Sony Corp said on Fridayit would spend 80 billion yen ($997 million) to boost productionof image sensors as part of its strategy to boost income fromdigital imaging.,TOKYO, June 22 Sony Corp said on Fridayit will invest 80 billion yen ($996.6 million) in its plant inNagasaki, western Japan, to increase production capacity of CMOSimage sensors used in smart phones.,* Nikkei retreats from one-month closing high    * Sony, Panasonic up; sources say to announce OLED tie-upnext wk    * Olympus rises, Nikkei says to receive 50 bln yen from Sony    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, June 22 Japan's Nikkei average fell onFriday as data showing U.S. manufacturing grew at its slowestpace in 11 months in June added to concerns about weaker growthin Europe and China, but the index was still headed for bestweekly gain in four months.    Economic-sensitive,* Nikkei retreats from one-month closing high    * Sony, Panasonic up; sources say to announce OLED tie-upnext wk    * Olympus rises, Nikkei says to receive 50 bln yen from Sony    TOKYO, June 22 Japan's Nikkei share average fellnearly 1 percent on Friday as data showing U.S. manufacturinggrew at its slowest pace in 11 months in June added to concernsabout weaker growth in Europe and China.    Economic-sensitive sectors were the major decliners, withthe mining sector down 2,Olympus Corp  is in final talks with Sony Corp  to get a roughly 50 billion yen ($622.86 million) capital injection in return for a stake, the Nikkei business daily reported on Friday, as the Japanese camera and medical equipment maker looks to rebuild from a huge accounting scandal.,* Olympus spokesman says deal not decided yet (Adds Olympus comment, background),TOKYO Rival Japanese television makers Sony Corp  and Panasonic Corp  will next week announce an agreement to cooperate in developing ways to mass produce next generation organic light emitting diode (OLED) televisions, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters Friday.

Title: Sony, Panasonic top candidates for Olympus tie: Asahi,Sony, Panasonic top candidates for Olympus tie-Asahi,Nikkei falls, Spain woes sap investor risk appetite
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  and Panasonic Corp  are the leading contenders to take an equity stake in Olympus Corp  as the scandal-hit medical equipment maker moves to shore up its finances, the Asahi Shimbun reported on Wednesday.,TOKYO, May 30 Sony Corp and PanasonicCorp are the leading contenders to take an equity stakein Olympus Corp as the scandal-hit medical equipmentmaker moves to shore up its finances, the Asahi Shimbun reportedon Wednesday.,* Renesas shares plummet; to outsource to Taiwan    * Sony edges up on bargain-hunting    * Worries about Spanish banks, bond yields dampen sentiment    By Sophie Knight	    TOKYO, May 29 Japan's Nikkei share average fellin early trading on Tuesday as investor wariness about adeepening euro zone crisis was fueled by reports that Spain'sgovernment could bailout an ailing bank with sovereign debt. 	    The Nikkei and the broader Topix index bothslipped 0.4 percent after Europ

Title: Sony CEO tells shareholders revival plan will work,UPDATE 1-Sony CEO tells shareholders revival plan will work,Sony aims to triple online games network sales in 3 yrs
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp's new CEO, Kazuo Hirai, on Wednesday defended retaining his predecessor, Howard Stringer, as chairman of the board and promised his turnaround strategy will save Japan's troubled consumer electronics giant.,TOKYO, June 27 Sony Corp's new CEO,Kazuo Hirai, on Wednesday defended retaining his predecessor,Howard Stringer, as chairman of the board and promised histurnaround strategy will save Japan's troubled consumerelectronics giant.,TOKYO, June 27 Sony Corp aims to triplesales from its online games network by March 2015, PresidentKazuo Hirai told an annual shareholders' meeting on Wednesday.

Title: Panasonic: OLED TV price won't fall to LCD level soon,Sony to sell chemical ops to state-backed bank for $727 million
Body: TOKYO Japan's Panasonic Corp does not expect prices of its next generation OLED (organic light emitting diode) televisions to fall to levels seen for LCD televisions for a considerable time, its new president told reporters on Thursday.,TOKYO Sony Corp  said on Thursday it plans to sell its chemical unit and chemical products operations to the state-backed Development Bank of Japan for 58 billion yen ($727 million), as it struggles to reduce costs.

Title: TEXT-Fitch:Sony, Panasonic attempt catch-up with OLED tie-up,Sony, Panasonic to cooperate on OLED televisions,UPDATE 1-Sony, Panasonic to cooperate on OLED televisions,Sony, Panasonic to cooperate in OLED mass production
Body: June 25 - Fitch Ratings says that the tie-up announced today between Panasonic Corporation (Panasonic, 'BBB-'/Negative) and Sony Corporation (Sony, 'BBB-'/Negative) todevelop organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels for TVs is a natural development given bothcompanies' necessity to develop new products in a cost-effective manner.,TOKYO Rival Japanese television makers Sony Corp and Panasonic Corp said Monday they will cooperate to make OLED (organic light emitting diode) sets as they battle Korean rivals Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics for pole position in the next-generation TV market.,* Japanese rivals fighting Samsung and LG for market share,TOKYO, June 25 Japanese television makers SonyCorp and Panasonic Corp said on Monday theywill cooperate to make OLED (organic light emitting diode)televisions as they battle Korean rivals Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics to take the lead inthe technology, widely seen as replacing current LCD TVs.

Title: Sony group wins U.S. approval to buy EMI music publishing,Sony group wins U.S. approval to buy EMI music publishing
Body: WASHINGTON The Federal Trade Commission has approved a Sony-led consortium's purchase of EMI Music Publishing, without having to make any divestitures, the FTC said on Friday.,WASHINGTON, June 29 The Federal Trade Commissionhas approved a Sony-led consortium's purchase of EMI MusicPublishing, without having to make any divestitures, the FTCsaid on Friday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Sony to buy U.S. game firm Gaikai for $380 mln
Body: San Francisco, July 2 Sony Corp said onMonday it would buy the privately held California-based gamingfirm Gaikai Inc for about $380 million as the money-losingelectronics maker seeks to strengthen its online gamingservices.

Title: 'Spider-Man' swings to $7.5 mln late-night debut
Body: LOS ANGELES, July 3 A movie reboot of the"Spider-Man" franchise snared $7.5 million in its web at U.S.and Canadian theaters from screenings just after midnight onTuesday, distributor Sony Pictures said.

Title: Euro zone adds barrier to Sony's revival hopes,Euro zone adds barrier to Sony's revival hopes
Body: TOKYO The debt crunch roiling Europe adds to the obstacles Sony Corp  and its new boss Kazuo Hirai are trying to overcome in tackling the losses that have dogged Japan's iconic maker of consumer electronic gadgets.,TOKYO, Aug 2 The debt crunch roiling Europe addsto the obstacles Sony Corp and its new boss Kazuo Hiraiare trying to overcome in tackling the losses that have doggedJapan's iconic maker of consumer electronic gadgets.

Title: Sony slashes profit outlook, Sharp cuts jobs first time in 60 years,UPDATE 4-Sony slashes profit outlook, Sharp cuts jobs first time in 60 years,Sony stumbles as demand wanes; slashes profit outlook,Sony Q1 operating profit down 77 pct from year earlier,Sony Q1 operating profit down 77 pct from year earlier,Sony cuts TV sales forecast for 2012/13 to 15.5 mln
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  slashed its forecast for 2012/13 operating profit and lowered its sales expectations for key products including its handheld PSP and PS Vita devices as new boss Kazuo Hirai battles to revive the fortunes of the electronics giant.,* Sharp reports operating loss, plans first job cuts sinceWW2,TOKYO Sony Corp slashed its forecast for 2012/13 operating profit and lowered its sales expectations for key products including its handheld PSP and PS Vita devices as new boss Kazuo Hirai battles to revive the fortunes of the electronics giant.,TOKYO, Aug 2 Sony Corp saidfirst-quarter operating profit slid from a year earlier as theiconic consumer electronics brand continued to struggle withweak demand for its TVs and other devices amid bitingcompetition from foreign rivals.,TOKYO, Aug 2 Sony Corp saidfirst-quarter operating profit slid from a year earlier as theiconic consumer electronics brand continued to struggle withweak demand for its TVs and other devices amid bitingcompetition from foreign rivals.,TOKYO, Aug 2 Sony cut its forecast forTV sales on Thursday, saying it now expects to sell 15.5 milliontelevisions in the business year to next March compared with itsforecast in May of 17.5 million.

Title: Nikkei slips as ECB disappoints; Sony, Sharp earnings drag,Nikkei slips as ECB disappoints; Sony, Sharp earnings drag,Nikkei drops, investors disappointed at ECB and Sony, Sharp misses,Nikkei sheds 1.6 pct on ECB, earnings from Sony, Sharp,Nikkei falls 1.1 pct to 1-week low after ECB disappoints
Body: TOKYO Japan's Nikkei average fell on Friday after the ECB disappointed investors by offering no immediate action to prop up the euro, with wide quarterly losses from Sharp and Sony adding to the gloom.,* Sharp slumps 28 pct, lowest close since 1976    * Sony sags 7 pct, lowest finish since 1980    * Fast Retailing up as July same-store sales beatexpectations    TOKYO, Aug 3 Japan's Nikkei average fell onFriday after the ECB disappointed investors by offering noimmediate action to prop up the euro, with wide quarterly lossesfrom Sharp and Sony adding to the gloom.    Both Sharp Corp and Sony Corp plummeted totheir lowest in more than three decades after posting heavylosse,TOKYO, Aug 3 Japan's Nikkei average fell onFriday after ECB chief Mario Draghi disappointed investors byoffering no immediate action to prop up the euro, with widequarterly losses from Sharp and Sony adding to the gloom.    The Nikkei dropped 1.1 percent to 8,555.11, whilethe broader Topix lost 1.2 percent to 723.94.,* Sharp slumps 29.6 pct, set for lowest close since 1976    * Sony sags 8.5 pct, on track for lowest close since 1980    * Fast Retailing up as July same-store sales beatexpectations    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, Aug 3 Japan's Nikkei average fell onFriday as ECB chief Mario Draghi disappointed investors byoffering mo immediate action to defend euro, with quarterlylosses from Sharp and Sony adding to the gloom.    Both Sharp Corp and Sony Corp were headingfor their lowest clo,* Sharp slumps 27.7 pct, set for lowest close since 1976    * Sony sags 7.1 pct, on track lowest close since 1980    * Fast Retailing up as July same-store sales beatexpectations    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, Aug 3 Japan's Nikkei share average shed1.1 percent in early trade on Friday after investors weredisappointed that European Central Bank chief Mario Draghi didnot match with immediate action his pledge last week to dowhatever needed to defend the euro.    Steep losses on

Title: Terumo's proposal intensifies race for Olympus tie-up,UPDATE 3-Terumo's proposal intensifies race for Olympus tie-up
Body: TOKYO Japan's Terumo Corp  announced on Thursday a proposal to invest 50 billion yen ($640 million) in capital-starved Olympus Corp , intensifying a race to join hands with the scandal-hit maker of cameras and endoscopes.,* Terumo offers to invest $640 mln in Olympus, set up jointholding firm

Title: Sony says to turn So-net into wholly owned unit,Sony says to turn So-net into wholly owned unit
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Thursday it plans to buy all the shares it does not already own in So-net Entertainment, an internet provider and medical information website operator, for about 60 billion yen ($765.70 million).,TOKYO, Aug 9 Sony Corp said on Thursdayit plans to buy all the shares it does not already own in So-netEntertainment, an internet provider and medicalinformation website operator, for about 60 billion yen ($765.70million).

Title: Moody's puts Sony on review for ratings downgrade
Body: Aug 6 Moody's Investors Service on Monday putSony Corporation's ratings on review for downgrade, saying itwas concerned that weak consumer sentiment globally and a strongyen would hurt earnings and debt at the Japanese electronicsgiant.

Title: Sony mulls hundreds of job cuts in Sweden: report,Sony mulls hundreds of job cuts in Sweden-report
Body: STOCKHOLM Sony Corp is considering hundreds of layoffs at a mobile phone plant in Sweden, a newspaper reported on Wednesday, in what would be one of the first major strategic decisions by the Japanese company on its former joint venture with Ericsson.,STOCKHOLM, Aug 22 Sony Corp isconsidering hundreds of layoffs at a mobile phone plant inSweden, a newspaper reported on Wednesday, in what would be oneof the first major strategic decisions by the Japanese companyon its former joint venture with Ericsson.

Title: Sony Mobile to cut 1,000 jobs
Body: Aug 23 Sony Corp will cut about 15percent of its global workforce at mobile phone unit Sony Mobileas the Japanese giant tries to integrate the struggling businesswith a series of measures including moving its headquarters.

Title: Sony to end optical disc drive business by March - report
Body: TOKYO, Aug 25 Sony Corp is to stopproducing optical disc drives for PCs by next March, Asahinewspaper said on Saturday, part of a restructuring aimed atreviving the fortunes of the company that gave the world theWalkman.

Title: Sony CEO says Vita gaming sales near expectations
Body: BERLIN Sony Chief Executive Kazuo Hirai said on Thursday that its new gaming device Vita was mostly selling in line with its expectations, though in some places it was off the pace.

Title: Sony mobile customers emails, names hacked in China,Sony mobile customers emails, names hacked in China
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp said hackers have accessed the email addresses and names of as many as 400 of its mobile unit's customers in China and Taiwan held on servers owned by a third-party vendor.,TOKYO, Sept 6 Japan's Sony Corp saidhackers have accessed the email addresses and names of as manyas 400 of its mobile unit's customers in China and Taiwan heldon servers owned by a third-party vendor.

Title: Sony eschews cheap tablets as it pursues Samsung,UPDATE 1-Sony eschews cheap tablets as it pursues Samsung,Sony won't compete on price in tablet market-executive
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp on Tuesday said it won't be drawn into price competition on tablet PCs amid a plethora of cheap models from other makers as it pursues Android rival Samsung Electronics with a new tablet out this month.,TOKYO, Sept 4 Sony Corp on Tuesday saidit won't be drawn into price competition on tablet PCs amid aplethora of cheap models from other makers as it pursues Androidrival Samsung Electronics with a new tablet out thismonth.,TOKYO, Sept 4 Sony Corp won't be drawninto price competition in the tablet PC market amid a plethoraof new cheap models from other makers, the executive in chargeof the Japanese company's mobile devices division said onTuesday.

Title: Sony launches Xperia tablet in push for mobile success,UPDATE 1-Sony launches Xperia tablet in push for mobile success,Sony unveils Xperia tablet, 3 smartphone models
Body: Sony Corp released an upgraded version of its Android tablet on Wednesday, branding its rival to Apple Inc's iPad and Samsung Electronics' Galaxy as "Xperia" in a bid to unify its mobile devices under one name.,Aug 29 Sony Corp released an upgradedversion of its Android tablet on Wednesday, branding its rivalto Apple Inc's iPad and Samsung Electronics' Galaxy as "Xperia" in a bid to unify its mobiledevices under one name.,BERLIN, Aug 29 Sony Corp unveiled onWednesday an upgraded version of its Android tablet and threenew smartphone models at a trade show in Berlin.The Xperia S tablet comes with a 9.4 inch screen and loaded withGoogle's latest Android software.

As of June 30, 2012, Sony's consolidated total cash, equivalents, and short-term securities, excluding those of its financial services segment, amounted to about JPY523.1 billion. The amount adequately covers short-term borrowings totaling JPY425.5 billion. In addition, Sony has unused credit facilities of JPY754.2 billion, which provides high flexibility.
