Lowered To 'BBB', Off CreditWatch,Sony set for $642 million investment in Olympus: sources,Sony set for $642 mln investment in Olympus -sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  will likely approve a plan this week to invest 50 billion yen ($642 million) in cash-strapped Olympus Corp , becoming its biggest shareholder with around a 10 percent stake, three sources familiar with the deal told Reuters.,(The following statement was released by the rating agency),* Sony and Olympus to establish joint medical equipment unit-sources,-- In our view, the pace of recovery in earnings of Sony'smainstay consumer electronics businesses will remain slow infiscal 2012, and a strong recovery is not likely to occur untilat least fiscal 2013.,TOKYO Sony Corp will likely approve a plan this week to invest 50 billion yen ($642 million) in cash-strapped Olympus Corp, becoming its biggest shareholder with around a 10 percent stake, three sources familiar with the deal told Reuters.,TOKYO, Sept 25 Sony Corp will likelyapprove a plan this week to invest 50 billion yen ($642 million)in cash-strapped Olympus Corp, becoming its biggestshareholder with around a 10 percent stake, three sourcesfamiliar with the deal told Reuters.

Title: Sony to invest $644 million in Olympus, become top shareholder,UPDATE 1-Sony to invest $644 mln in Olympus, become top shareholder,Sony to pay $644 mln for Olympus stake -filing
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  will pay 50 billion yen ($643.5 million) to become the biggest shareholder in Olympus Corp , and establish a company with the cash-strapped Japanese camera and endoscope maker to develop medical equipment.,TOKYO, Sept 28 Sony Corp will pay 50billion yen ($643.5 million) to become the biggest shareholderin Olympus Corp, and establish a company with thecash-strapped Japanese camera and endoscope maker to developmedical equipment.,TOKYO, Sept 28 Sony Corp will pay atotal of 50 billion yen ($643.5 million), including fees, for astake in cash-strapped camera and endoscope maker Olympus Corp, with the two agreeing to establish a joint company todevelop medical equipment, a filing showed on Friday.

Title: BRIEF-Moody's comments on Sony's Capital and business alliance with Olympus
Body: * Moody's says that Sony Corporation's (Baa1/Prime-2, review for downgrade) alliance withOlympus Corporation (unrated) will make it more challenging for Sony to reduce its high leveragein a timely manner.

Title: Analysis: Is Sony buying time - or problems?
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp CEO Kazuo Hirai has spent $1.8 billion in the past three months snapping up an assortment of businesses such as medical equipment and cloud gaming, leaving investors to worry he is blowing his firm's waning finances on a muddled plan to revive the fading giant.

Title: Analysis: Is Sony buying time - or problems?
Body: SINGAPORE Sony Corp  CEO Kazuo Hirai has spent $1.8 billion in the past three months snapping up an assortment of businesses such as medical equipment and cloud gaming, leaving investors to worry he is blowing his firm's waning finances on a muddled plan to revive the fading giant.

Title: Sony halts Xperia tablet sales after defect found,UPDATE 1-Sony halts Xperia tablet sales after defect found,Sony halts sales of Xperia tablets on poor water resistance-Jiji
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said it has halted sales of its Xperia tablet PCs, a month after its launch, after discovering gaps between the screen and the case that make some of the machines susceptible to water damage.,TOKYO, Oct 5 Sony Corp said it hashalted sales of its Xperia tablet PCs, a month after its launch,after discovering gaps between the screen and the case that makesome of the machines susceptible to water damage.,TOKYO, Oct 5 Sony Corp has halted salesof its Xperia tablet PCs, which the Japanese electronics firmlaunched to compete with Apple Inc's iPads, afterfinding some models had low water resistance, Jiji News Agencysaid on Friday.

Title: Sony's debt rating cut by Moody's on weak profitability
Body: TOKYO, Oct 12 Sony Corp's long-termdebt rating was lowered one notch by Moody's Investor Service tothe second-lowest investment grade because of weak profitabilityin products ranging from televisions to mobile phones.

Title: BRIEF-Moody's comments on Sony's Capital and business alliance with Olympus
Body: * Moody's says that Sony Corporation's (Baa1/Prime-2, review for downgrade) alliance withOlympus Corporation (unrated) will make it more challenging for Sony to reduce its high leveragein a timely manner.

Title: Sony to cut HQ staff by a fifth, shutter Japan plant,UPDATE 1-Sony to cut HQ staff by a fifth, shutter Japan plant,Japan's Sony to cut 2,000 jobs in restructuring
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said it will cut staff in its headquarters by a fifth and shutter a factory making camera lenses and mobile phones in Japan, providing new details of a previously announced plan to trim its global headcount by 10,000 by end-March.,* Says job reduction in Japan of 3,800 people by March end,TOKYO, Oct 19 Sony Corp said on Fridayit would cut 2,000 jobs in the year to March 2013 as part of arestructuring plan aimed at speeding up reforms in itsstruggling electronics business.

Title: Sony to close tech centre in Tokyo to trim costs
Body: TOKYO, Oct 23 Sony Corp said it willclose an office building in Tokyo and relocate the 4,800 peoplewho work there to other sites in and around Japan's capital tohelp squeeze costs as it seeks to return to profit.

Title: Amazon joins crowded field with Japan Kindle release
Body: * Amazon up against Rakuten, Apple & Google, Sony in Japan

Title: Sony to close Tokyo tech center to trim costs,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Sony to close Tokyo tech center to trim costs
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp plans to shut operations in a Tokyo office building that houses 8 percent of its Japan staff, one of the first concrete moves by the electronics and entertainment company to pave the way for 4,000 job cuts.,(Corrects Oct 23 story to remove "retreat from its money-losingTV manufacturing operations" in fourth paragraph.)

Title: Sharp fears for future as Japan TV makers bleed,WRAPUP 2-Sharp fears for future as Japan TV makers bleed,WRAPUP 1-Sony, Sharp in turnaround battle; Panasonic battered,Sony posts small second-quarter profit, keeps full-year forecast,Sony says $375 million impact on China sales from protests, economy,Nikkei ticks up after China PMI data, Panasonic plunges,Sony says $375 mln impact on China sales from protests, economy,UPDATE 1-Sony posts small Q2 profit, keeps full-year forecast,Sony posts Q2 operating profit of 30.30 bln yen,Sony cuts PSP, Vita 2012/13 sales forecast to 10 million from 12 million
Body: TOKYO Struggling Japanese TV maker Sharp Corp warned it might not be able to survive on its own, as it almost doubled its full-year net loss forecast to $5.6 billion, and said it was considering alliances with other companies.,* Sony Q2 oper profit 30.3 bln yen; keeps FY fcast for 130bln yen profit,* Panasonic shares dive 19 pct, $3 bln wiped off mkt value,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp booked a small operating profit in the second quarter, after a loss a year ago, helped by the sale of a chemicals business that offset weak demand for its TVs and other devices, and it kept its full-year profit guidance.,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp said Thursday that anti-Japan sentiment in China and weakness in the world's second-largest economy is likely to dent the company's sales by 30 billion yen ($375.3 million) in the year ending next March 31.,* Analysts say Sharp and Sony's results priced in    * Panasonic slumps 20 pct after huge net loss forecast    * China-related stocks surge    * TDK and Fujifilm fall after cutting their outlook    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Nov 1 Japan's Nikkei average edged up onThursday as a pick-up in Chinese manufacturing helped heavymachinery makers and shippers, offsetting weakness in PanasonicCorp.    China-related shares such as construction equipment makersKomatsu Ltd and Hitachi,TOKYO, Nov 1 Japan's Sony Corp saidThursday that anti-Japan sentiment in China and weakness in theworld's second-largest economy is likely to dent the company'ssales by 30 billion yen ($375.3 million) in the year ending nextMarch 31.,TOKYO, Nov 1 Japan's Sony Corp booked asmall operating profit in the second quarter, after a loss ayear ago, helped by the sale of a chemicals business that offsetweak demand for its TVs and other devices, and it kept itsfull-year profit guidance.,TOKYO, Nov 1 Japan's Sony Corp returnedto an operating profit in the second quarter after a loss a yearago, helped by the sale of a chemicals business that offset weakdemand for its TVs and other devices, and it kept its full-yearprofit guidance.,TOKYO Sony Corp cut its forecast for full-year sales of handheld PSP and Vita game consoles to 10 million compared with a prediction it made in August for 12 million.

Title: Changing channels; Sony, Sharp in turnaround battle,Changing channels; Sony, Sharp in turnaround battle
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp is likely to say it returned to an operating profit for July-September after it sold a chemicals business, but investors still aren't sure a consumer electronics revamp will deliver the profit growth the group seeks.,TOKYO, Nov 1 Sony Corp is likely to sayit returned to an operating profit for July-September after itsold a chemicals business, but investors still aren't sure aconsumer electronics revamp will deliver the profit growth thegroup seeks.

Title: BRIEF-Moody's comments on Sony's 1H2012 results,Sony rises after it posts small profit, keeps annual guidance
Body: * Moody's says that weak economic conditions and structural changes continue to pressureearnings from Sony Corporation's (Baa2/Prime-2, negative) electronics business, following theannouncement of its 1H2012 financial results.,TOKYO Shares of Sony Corp climbed 3.6 percent to 948 yen on Friday after the consumer electronics maker posted a small operating profit in the second quarter and kept its full-year profit guidance.

Title: Sony says online network chief quits,Sony says online network chief quits
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp's network strategy chief, Tim Schaaff, will quit next month after leading the Japanese company's efforts to build a unified online content delivery platform to compete with Apple Inc  for the past seven years.,TOKYO, Nov 8 Sony Corp's network strategy chief,Tim Schaaff, will quit next month after leading the Japanesecompany's efforts to build a unified online content deliveryplatform to compete with Apple Inc for the past sevenyears.

Title: Moody's cuts Sony rating to one notch above junk,Moody's cuts Sony rating to one notch above junk,BRIEF-Moody's cuts Sony to Baa3;outlook negative
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp's long-term debt rating was lowered one notch by Moody's Investor Service to the lowest investment grade level because of shrinking demand for its consumer electronics.,TOKYO, Nov 9 Sony Corp's long-term debtrating was lowered one notch by Moody's Investor Service to thelowest investment grade level because of shrinking demand forits consumer electronics.,* Moody's downgrades the issuer and long-term senior unsecured bond ratings of SonyCorporation to Baa3 from Baa2. At the same time, Moody's also downgraded the short-term ratingsof Sony and its supported subsidiary, Sony Global Treasury Services Plc., to Prime-3 fromPrime-2.

Title: Nikkei posts biggest pct rise in a month buoyed by Abe's comments,Sony tumbles on convertible bonds issue,UPDATE 2-Sony tumbles on convertible bonds issue,Nikkei climbs to 1-week high as softer yen boosts exporters,Nikkei rises to 1-week high, led by exporters as yen weakens,Sony tumbles after saying to issue convertible bonds,Sony says liable to $585 mln reimbursements after debt downgrade
Body: * Exporters and contractors jump as Abe backs sub-zero rates,TOKYO Shares of Sony Corp  tumbled over 10 percent on Thursday, a day after the consumer electronics maker said it will raise 150 billion yen ($1.9 billion) through a sale of convertible bonds to help finance a series of investments.,* If price level holds, close would be lowest since 1980 (Adds comment on convertible bonds),* Nikkei up 1 pct, Topix rises 1.1 pct    * Sony tumbles after saying to issue convertible bonds    * Banks in demand after H1 results    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, Nov 15 Japan's Nikkei average rose to aone-week high on Thursday, supported by gains for exporters ashopes that a new government could lead to easier monetary policyweakened the yen, but Sony Corp tumbled on a fundraising plan.    By the midday break, the Nikkei advanced 1 percentto 8,748.29 Points, breaking above,* Nikkei up 1 pct, Topix rises 1.1 pct    * Sony tumbles after saying to issue convertible bonds    * Banks in demand after H1 results    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, Nov 15 Japan's Nikkei rose to a one-weekhigh on Thursday, supported by gains for exporters as hopes thata new government could lead to easier monetary policy weakenedthe yen, but Sony sank on a fundraising plan.    Sony slumped 10.3 percent after the consumerelectronics maker said it will raise $1.9 billion throug,TOKYO Shares of Sony Corp  tumbled 10.5 percent to 778 yen on Thursday after the consumer electronics maker said it will raise $1.9 billion through a sale of convertible bonds, a third of which will be used for investment in Olympus Corp .,TOKYO, Nov 15 Sony Corp said a Moody'sdowngrade of its credit rating last week means that some of itscommercial clients would be able to demand up to $585 million inimmediate reimbursement on advances paid to Sony.

Title: Sony PlayStation certificate sparks talk China may lift console ban,Sony PlayStation certificate sparks talk China may lift console ban
Body: TOKYO/SHANGHAI Sony Corp's PlayStation 3 has received a certification of quality from a Chinese safety standards body, sparking speculation that China will end a decade-old ban on home game consoles.,

Title: UPDATE 1-Moody's cuts Panasonic's debt rating to one notch above junk
Body: TOKYO, Nov 20 Moody's Investor Service cutPanasonic Corp's long term debt rating by two notchesto its lowest investment grade on Tuesday, saying dwindlingsales of its consumer electronic devices were pressuringearnings.

Title: Sony to raise $1.9 billion through convertible bonds issue,UPDATE 1-Sony to raise $1.9 bln through convertible bonds issue,Sony to issue $1.9 bln worth convertible bonds -filing
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp said on Wednesday it will raise 150 billion yen ($1.9 billion) through a sale of convertible bonds, a third of which will be used for investment in Olympus Corp.,* Bonds will also be used to fund US buy, repay debt, expandops (Adds details of issue),TOKYO, Nov 14 Japan's Sony Corp said onWednesday it will sell 150 billion yen ($1.9 billion) worth ofconvertible bonds to repay debt and pay for a planned ramping upin CMOS image sensors and other investments, it said in afiling.

Title: Sony at greater risk than Panasonic in electronics downturn: Fitch,UPDATE 1-Sony at greater risk than Panasonic in electronics downturn-Fitch,Sony at greater risk than Panasonic in electronics downturn-Fitch,TEXT-Fitch Teleconf: Sony and Panasonic Downgrade, 11:30am Tokyo, 23 Nov
Body: TOKYO Panasonic Corp has a better chance than rival Sony Corp of surviving Japan's consumer electronics slump because of its unglamorous but stable appliance business of washing machines and fridges, credit rating agency Fitch said Friday.,TOKYO, Nov 23 Panasonic Corp has abetter chance than rival Sony Corp of surviving Japan'sconsumer electronics slump because of its unglamorous but stableappliance business of washing machines and fridges, creditrating agency Fitch said Friday.,TOKYO, Nov 23 Panasonic Corp has abetter chance than rival Sony Corp of surviving Japan'sconsumer electronics slump because of its unglamorous but stableappliance business of washing machines and fridges, creditrating agency Fitch said Friday.,TOKYO/SEOUL/SINGAPORE, November 23 (Fitch) Fitch Ratingswill hold a teleconference at 11:30am (Tokyo/Seoul time), Friday23 November 2012, to discuss the decline of the Japanesetechnology giants.

Title: Fitch cuts Sony, Panasonic debt ratings to "junk" status,UPDATE 2-Fitch cuts Sony, Panasonic debt ratings to 'junk' status,Fitch cuts Sony, Panasonic debt ratings to junk,TEXT-Fitch:Japanese tech giants - fallen angels,TEXT-Fitch cuts Sony to speculative grade;outlook negative
Body: TOKYO Ratings agency Fitch downgraded the debt ratings of Japan's Sony Corp and Panasonic Corp to "junk" status citing weakness in their consumer electronics and TV operations, further diminishing the luster of the once-great Japanese brands.,* Sony downgraded by 3 notches to BB-minus, Panasonic by 2to BB,TOKYO, Nov 22 Ratings agency Fitch said onThursday it was cutting the debt ratings of consumer electronicsmakers Sony Corp and Panasonic Corp to junkstatus, citing weakness in their business.,(The following statement was released by the rating agency),(The following statement was released by the rating agency)

Title: Exclusive: Banks offer to help Sony offload battery unit - sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp has been approached by at least three investment banks offering to sell its battery business as the struggling Japanese group looks to offload non-core assets and focus on reviving its consumer electronics business, banking sources said.

Title: Sony's PlayStation3 beats Nintendo's Wii U over Black Friday,Sony's PlayStation3 beats Nintendo's Wii U over Black Friday
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Sony Corp sold over 525,000 PlayStation3 consoles in the United States during the week of Black Friday that kicks off the holiday shopping season, surpassing sales of Nintendo's new Wii U.,SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 29 Sony Corp soldover 525,000 PlayStation3 consoles in the United States duringthe week of Black Friday that kicks off the holiday shoppingseason, surpassing sales of Nintendo's new Wii U.

Title: Former Vivendi boss to run France's Thales
Body: ISTRES, France/PARIS Jean-Bernard Levy emerged on Wednesday as the next chief executive of French arms firm Thales, months after a strategy dispute cost him his job as head of media and telecoms group Vivendi.

Title: Olympus, Sony say medical business merger delayed,UPDATE 1-Olympus, Sony say medical business merger delayed,Olympus says medical business merger with Sony delayed
Body: TOKYO Japan's Olympus Corp  and Sony Corp  said on Friday that a planned merger of the two firms' medical business will take longer than expected due to delays in obtaining regulatory approval abroad.,* Olympus shares down 1.8 pct, Sony shares flat (Adds Sony comment, shares),TOKYO, Dec 21 Japan's Olympus Corp saidon Friday that a planned merger of its medical business withSony Corp would take longer than expected due to delaysin obtaining regulatory approval abroad.

Title: US senators slam Sony for film suggesting torture helped find bin Laden
Body: WASHINGTON, Dec 19 Several top U.S. senatorschided Sony Pictures on Wednesday, saying new film "Zero DarkThirty" is "grossly inaccurate and misleading" for suggestingtorture helped the United States capture Osama bin Laden.

Title: Exclusive: Banks offer to help Sony offload battery unit - sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp has been approached by at least three investment banks offering to sell its battery business as the struggling Japanese group looks to offload non-core assets and focus on reviving its consumer electronics business, banking sources said.

Title: UPDATE 1-Sony says China business has recovered, foresees growth,Sony says China business back at pre-dispute level
Body: * Sony emerging markets business to grow 40 pct by FY 2014 (Adds comment),BEIJING, Dec 25 Sony Corp's business inChina has "more or less" returned to levels seen before recentprotests over Japan's actions over a group of disputed islands,the Japanese company's China chief, Nobuki Kurita, toldreporters on Tuesday.

Title: In giant "garage sale", Japan's TV giants hawk $3 billion of assets,In giant 'garage sale', Japan's TV giants hawk $3 bln of assets
Body: TOKYO Panasonic Corp, Japan's struggling maker of Viera brand TVs, owns more than 10 million square meters of office and factory space, dormitories for its workers and sports facilities for its rugby, baseball and women's athletics teams.,TOKYO, Dec 10 Panasonic Corp, Japan'sstruggling maker of Viera brand TVs, owns more than 10 millionsquare metres of office and factory space, dormitories for itsworkers and sports facilities for its rugby, baseball andwomen's athletics teams.

Body: LAS VEGAS Sony Corp is considering the sale of its battery business but has made no decision yet, Chief Executive Kazuo Hirai said on Monday, as the company seeks to offload non-core assets and revive its consumer electronics business.,* CEO Hirai says to start selling 4K movies in U.S. thisspring,LAS VEGAS Sony Corp is considering the sale of its battery business but it has made no decision yet, Chief Executive Kazuo Hirai said on Monday, as the company looks to offload non-core assets and focus on reviving its fortunes.,LAS VEGAS, Jan 7 Sony Corp isconsidering the sale of its battery business but it has made nodecision yet, Chief Executive Kazuo Hirai said on Monday, as thecompany looks to offload non-core assets and focus on revivingits fortunes.,LAS VEGAS, Jan 7 Sony Corp will launchnext-generation 4K versions of existing movie titles in springthis year, its CEO Kazuo Hirai said at a press conference at theCES consumer electronics show in Las Vegas on Monday.

Body: TERRA FIRMA EYES BIG PICTURE IN PLANS TO SELL ODEON CHAINMORRISON LOSES MANAGER BEFORE SALES UPDATE,Jan 7 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media on Monday:,Jan 7 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media on Monday:,TERRA FIRMA EYES BIG PICTURE IN PLANS TO SELL ODEON CHAINMORRISON LOSES MANAGER BEFORE SALES UPDATE,TOKYO Sony Corp is joining with BMG to bid for Parlophone and other EMI labels on sale by Universal Music, reuniting Sony and Bertelsmann four years after they ended their music joint venture, the Financial Times said on Monday.,TOKYO, Jan 7 Sony Corp is joining withBMG to bid for Parlophone and other EMI labels on sale byUniversal Music, reuniting Sony and Bertelsmann fouryears after they ended their music joint venture, the FinancialTimes said on Monday.

Title: Ambitious Piercy in contention at Waialae
Body: Scott Piercy took an encouraging step forward in his aim of becoming a multiple PGA Tour winner this year by charging into contention in the opening round of the Sony Open in Hawaii on Thursday.

Title: First-round bids for NYC's Sony Tower due on Monday,First-round bids for NYC's Sony Tower due on Monday,UPDATE 1-In giant 'garage sale', Japan's TV giants hawk $3 bln of assets

Body: TOKYO, Jan 10 Sony Corp has put one ofits main buildings in central Tokyo up for sale in a deal thatcould raise up to 100 billion yen ($1.14 billion) as the companyseeks to sell non-core assets to boost its balance sheet, fivepeople with direct knowledge of the deal said.,TOKYO Sony Corp  has put one of its main buildings in central Tokyo up for sale in a deal that could raise as much as 100 billion yen ($1.14 billion) as the company seeks to sell non-core assets to generate cash to improve its balance sheet, people with direct knowledge of the deal said.,(Corrects headline figure to $1.1 billion, corrects number ofemployees in second paragraph, corrects area in final paragraphto square metres)

Title: Ice-cool rookie Henley sets record pace at Waialae,Johnson pulls out of Waialae due to flu
Body: American Russell Henley, surprisingly unflappable for a PGA Tour rookie, lived his dream for a second consecutive day at the Sony Open in Hawaii as he charged into a two-shot lead in record style on Friday.,Dustin Johnson's bid to complete a rare victory sweep in Hawaii ended prematurely on Friday when he withdrew from the Sony Open because of flu after completing just nine holes in the second round.

Title: PGA Tour rookies reign supreme at Waialae
Body: Rookies ruled for a third consecutive day in record style at the Sony Open in Hawaii as good friends Russell Henley and Scott Langley ended Saturday's third round in a tie for the lead.

Title: Rookie Henley wins by three shots at Waialae
Body: American Russell Henley, remarkably unflappable for a PGA Tour rookie, became the youngest ever champion at the Sony Open in Hawaii when he won his maiden title on the U.S. circuit by three shots on Sunday.

Body: NEW YORK, Jan 18 U.S.-listed shares of foreigncompanies edged lower on Friday as a weaker-than-expected reporton U.S. consumer sentiment took the steam out of earlier dataindicating economic momentum in China may be picking up.,NEW YORK/TOKYO, Jan 18 Japan's Sony Corp said it would sell its U.S. headquarters building inNew York City for $1.1 billion, the highest price paid for asingle U.S. office building in two years, to a consortium led byreal estate developer The Chetrit Group.,* Investors buy derivatives - trader    * Credit Suisse upgrades Japan on short-term    * Sony surges on New York building sale    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Jan 18 Japan's Nikkei share average rosemore than 2 percent on Friday and is set for a 10th straightweek of gains as exporters advanced on expectations the centralbank will ease monetary policy aggressively next week, puttingmore downward pressure on the yen.    The Nikkei rose 2.2 percent to 10,842.24 points bythe mi,TOKYO, Jan 18 Sony Corp has sold its37-storey New York headquarters for $1.1 billion, realising again of $685 million it can book as operating income and helpingits bid to return to profit.,Sony Corp  said it has agreed to sell its U.S. headquarters building in New York City for $1.1 billion to a consortium led by real estate developer The Chetrit Group.,LA QUINTA, California Four days after winning his maiden PGA Tour title, American rookie Russell Henley made light of a fatigued start to the week as he surged into contention at the Humana Challenge on Thursday.

Title: Japan wants Nissan-NEC venture to buy Sony battery operations: media,UPDATE 1-Japan wants Nissan-NEC venture to buy Sony battery ops-media,Japan wants Nissan-NEC venture to take on Sony battery ops -media
Body: TOKYO A Japanese state-backed fund wants a Nissan Motor Co Ltd and NEC Corp joint venture to buy Sony Corp's lithium-ion battery unit to prevent rivals in China and Taiwan from getting its technology as the Tokyo TV maker looks to offload non-core businesses, the Daily Yomiuri said.,TOKYO, Jan 25 A Japanese state-backed fund wantsa Nissan Motor Co Ltd and NEC Corp jointventure to buy Sony Corp's lithium-ion battery unit toprevent rivals in China and Taiwan from getting its technologyas the Tokyo TV maker looks to offload non-core businesses, theDaily Yomiuri said.,TOKYO, Jan 25 A state-backed fund wants aventure owned by Nissan Motor Co Ltd and NEC Corp to merge with Sony Corp's lithium ion batteryoperations to prevent rivals in China and Taiwan from capturingkey technologies, the Yomiuri newspaper said on Friday.

Title: Flawless Kuchar takes control at Riviera
Body: PACIFIC PALISADES, California Matt Kuchar, revitalized after a three-week break, took advantage of ideal early scoring conditions to charge into a one-shot lead in the first round of the Northern Trust Open on Thursday.

Title: Sony seeks head start over Microsoft with new PlayStation,TEXT-Fitch: PlayStation 4 unlikely to be Sony's Saviour,UPDATE 4-Sony seeks head start over Microsoft with new PlayStation
Body: NEW YORK Sony Corp said it will launch its next-generation PlayStation this year, hoping its first video game console in seven years will give it a much-needed head start over the next version of Microsoft's Xbox and help revive its stumbling electronics business. |¶ÿ,HONG KONG/SYDNEY, February 21 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings saysSony Corporation's (Sony, BB-/Negative) next generation console,PlayStation 4, is unlikely to deliver sufficient cash flow toturn around the company's credit profile. In the console marketthe PlayStation will continue to face tough competition fromMicrosoft Corporation's (AA+/Stable) Xbox brand as bothcompanies attempt to provide a media hub for living roominternet entertainment and Nintendo's Wii products will continueto appeal to ,NEW YORK, Feb 20 Sony Corp said it willlaunch its next-generation PlayStation this year, hoping itsfirst video game console in seven years will give it amuch-needed head start over the next version of Microsoft's Xboxand help revive its stumbling electronics business.

Body: NEW YORK, Feb 20 Sony Corp took thewraps off its next-generation video game console called"PlayStation4" on Wednesday.,NEW YORK Sony Corp took the wraps off its next-generation video game console called "PlayStation4" on Wednesday.,NEW YORK, Feb 20 Sony Corp took thewraps off its next-generation video game console called"PlayStation4" on Wednesday.,* Sony to host PlayStation event in New York on Wednesday2300 GMT,TOKYO Sony Corp said on Wednesday that it would sell six percent of shares in its consolidated subsidiary M3 Inc, and as a result post a 115 billion yen ($1.23 billion) operating profit for the year through March 2013.,TOKYO, Feb 20 Sony Corp said onWednesday that it would sell six percent of shares in itsconsolidated subsidiary M3 Inc, and as a result post a115 billion yen ($1.23 billion) operating profit for the yearthrough March 2013.

Title: Sony's Xperia Z smartphone off to a good start: executive
Body: BARCELONA Sales of Sony Corp's Xperia Z high-end smartphone have got off to a good start since its launch in several leading European markets on Monday, said Sony Mobile's Calum MacDougall, head of Xperia marketing.

Title: Sony aims to triple India mobile phone sales in year to March 2014
Body: NEW DELHI, March 6 Sony Corp aims totriple sales of its mobile phones in India to 35 billion rupees($638 million) in the year to March 2014, Kenichiro Hibi,managing director of its India unit, said, at the launch of thecompany's Xperia Z high-end smartphone.

Title: Sony's board chairman and ex-CEO Stringer to retire: FT,Sony's board chairman and ex-CEO Stringer to retire - FT
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp's board chairman Howard Stringer, who headed the company as chief executive for six years until last April, will retire from Japan's struggling consumer electronics giant in June, the Financial Times reported.,TOKYO, March 9 Sony Corp's boardchairman Howard Stringer, who headed the company as chiefexecutive for six years until last April, will retire fromJapan's struggling consumer electronics giant in June, theFinancial Times reported.

Body: TOKYO Sony Corp has sold one of its most prized Tokyo office buildings to Japanese real estate trust Nippon Building Fund Inc and one other investor for 111 billion yen ($1.2 billion), its second high-profile building sale this year.,TOKYO, Feb 28 Sony Corp has sold one ofits most prized Tokyo office buildings to Japanese real estatetrust Nippon Building Fund Inc and one other investorfor 111 billion yen ($1.2 billion), its second high-profilebuilding sale this year.,(Corrects to say gain from sale will be 41 bln yen, notoperating profit),TOKYO, Feb 28 Sony Corp said it hassold a Tokyo office building to Japanese real estate trustNippon Building Fund Inc and one other investor for 111billion yen ($1.2 billion).

Body: TOKYO, Feb 18 Sony Corp on Mondayslashed the price of its struggling Vita handheld games consolein Japan in a bid to spur sales of the device as gamers switchto free or cheap games played on tablet computers andsmartphones.,TOKYO Sony Corp on Monday slashed the price of its struggling Vita handheld games console in Japan in a bid to spur sales of the device as gamers switch to free or cheap games played on tablet computers and smartphones.,TOKYO, Feb 18 Sony Corp on Mondayslashed the price of its struggling Vita handheld games consolein Japan in a bid to spur sales of the device as gamers switchto free or cheap games played on tablet computers andsmartphones.

Title: Panasonic sells third Tokyo property, raises $536 million
Body: TOKYO, March 5 Panasonic Corp has solda central Tokyo building for around 50 billion yen ($536million) to two Japanese investors, including the buyer of anoffice block Sony Corp sold last week.

Title: UPDATE 1-Software co. Intertrust accuses Apple of infringing patents
Body: March 20 Intertrust Technologies Corp, asoftware firm owned by a group that includes Sony Corp and Royal Philips Electronics, said on Wednesday it hassued Apple Inc for infringing 15 patents relating tosecurity.

Title: Serena wins first match back as number one
Body: MIAMI Serena Williams, playing her first match since regaining the world number one ranking, made a triumphant start to the Sony Open, thumping Italy's Flavia Pennetta 6-1 6-1 on Thursday.

Title: Ferrer ends Haas run to reach Miami final,Berdych to miss Czech Davis Cup quarter-final,Sony, Olympus delay medical venture as regulatory approval on hold,Sony, Olympus delay medical venture as regulatory approval on hold
Body: MIAMI Spain's David Ferrer ended German Tommy Haas's dream of reaching the Sony Open final with a 4-6 6-2 6-3 victory in Friday's semi-final.,PRAGUE World number six Tomas Berdych will miss Czech Republic's Davis Cup quarter-final next week when the champions take on Kazakhstan.,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  and Olympus Corp  have again delayed the start of a joint venture to develop medical equipment because they have yet to gain approval from some regulators.,TOKYO, March 29 Japan's Sony Corp andOlympus Corp have again delayed the start of a jointventure to develop medical equipment because they have yet togain approval from some regulators.

Title: Sharapova, Ferrer reach semi-finals in Miami,Battle-scarred Haas still turning back the clock,Veteran Haas ends Djokovic dominance in Miami
Body: Maria Sharapova was shaky from the service line but the Russian world number two dodged danger at key moments to beat seventh seed Sara Errani 7-5 7-5 and reach the semi-finals of the Sony Open in Miami on Wednesday.,Just shy of his 35th birthday with a battle-scarred body after numerous career-saving surgeries, Tommy Haas produced the shock of the year so far by outclassing world number one Novak Djokovic in Miami on Tuesday.,Germany's Tommy Haas recorded the upset of the tournament when he stunned two-time defending champion Novak Djokovic 6-2 6-4 in the fourth round of the Sony Open at Miami on Tuesday.

Title: Murray goes to number two with Miami tie-break win over Ferrer
Body: MIAMI Britain's Andy Murray defeated Spain's David Ferrer 2-6 6-4 7-6 in a grueling and enthralling Sony Open final on Sunday to move above Roger Federer to second in the world rankings.

Title: Williams sinks Sharapova for record sixth Miami title
Body: MIAMI World number one Serena Williams fought back from a set down to beat Maria Sharapova 4-6 6-3 6-0 and win the Sony Open for a record sixth time on Saturday as she continued her dominance over her closest rival.

Title: Djokovic eyes return to form in Davis Cup tie versus U.S
Body: BOISE, Idaho Novak Djokovic believes he has left his recent poor form behind and will be in top shape when he leads Serbia in this weekend's Davis Cup quarter-final tie against the United States.

Title: Sharapova into Sony Open final, Murray to semis
Body: MIAMI Russia's Maria Sharapova demolished Serbia's Jelena Jankovic 6-2 6-1 on Thursday to book her place in the final of the Sony Open, one of the few titles missing from her CV.

Title: Boosted by digital, Hollywood home entertainment sales grow 5 percent
Body: Hollywood studios saw sales of Blu-ray, online distribution and other home viewing of their movies grow by 5 percent in the first quarter in comparison to only 0.23 percent for all of last year.

Title: Venus pulls out of Madrid Open with back problem
Body: MADRID Former world number one Venus Williams has been forced to withdraw from the Madrid Open due to a back problem, organizers said on Sunday.

Title: Sony bid to revive electronics to hinge on smartphones,Sony sees smartphone sales rising to 42 million this year,Sony sees smartphone sales rising to 42 mln this year
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp's bid for revival as a consumer electronics maker this business year will hinge on the fortunes of its latest smartphones, as it struggles with shrinking sales of its TVs, digital cameras and game consoles. |¶ÿ,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp said it expects mobile phone sales to rise to 42 million in the year to March 31 compared with 33 million sold in the business year just ended, as it tries to establish itself as No. 3 in the global smartphone market behind Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co.,TOKYO, May 9 Japan's Sony Corp said itexpects mobile phone sales to rise to 42 million in the year toMarch 31 compared with 33 million sold in the business year justended, as it tries to establish itself as No. 3 in the globalsmartphone market behind Apple Inc and SamsungElectronics Co.

Title: LulzSec hackers who "wreaked havoc" at Sony jailed in UK
Body: LONDON A group of British hackers who "ran riot" causing millions of dollars of damage to computer networks run by Sony, the CIA and other agencies were sentenced to jail terms on Thursday.

Title: Nvidia delays new game device after finding problem,Nvidia delays new game device after finding problem
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Nvidia Corp  is delaying sales of its new handheld game gadget, a setback in the chipmaker's bid to use its appeal with personal computer gamers to challenge console makers like Sony Corp  and Microsoft Corp .,SAN FRANCISCO, June 26 Nvidia Corp isdelaying sales of its new handheld game gadget, a setback in thechipmaker's bid to use its appeal with personal computer gamersto challenge console makers like Sony Corp andMicrosoft Corp.

Title: Sony says Dubai dealers sold Iran $12.8 million in equipment,CORRECTED-Sony says Dubai dealers sold Iran $12.8 mln in equipment
Body: Sony Corp said some dealers in Dubai resold about $12.8 million worth of its video equipment and medical instruments to Iranian ministries, in a move that could possibly attract U.S. penalties.,(Corrects net profit in paragraph 5 to less than $500,000, not$500 mln)

Title: Every takes charge, Mickelson misses cut
Body: American Matt Every birdied his final hole to break clear of a congested leaderboard as fan favorite Phil Mickelson missed the cut after Friday's second round of the Greenbrier Classic at White Sulphur Springs in West Virginia.

Title: Apple signs deal with Warner for streaming music: reports,REFILE-Apple signs deal with Warner for streaming music -reports
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has signed an agreement with Warner Music Group for music licenses in a push to create a streaming music service to unveil at a conference of its developers next week, the New York Times and Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing anonymous sources. |¶ÿ,SAN FRANCISCO, June 3 Apple Inc hassigned an agreement with Warner Music Group for music licensesin a push to create a streaming music service to unveil at aconference of its developers next week, the New York Times andWall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing anonymoussources.

Title: Universal lures 'Dark Knight' producer Tull from Warner Brothers,Universal lures 'Dark Knight' producer Tull from Warner Brothers
Body: LOS ANGELES NBCUniversal, cable giant Comcast's Hollywood unit, has signed Thomas Tull, luring the producer behind big budget blockbusters such as "The Dark Knight" and "Man of Steel" away from Warner Brothers and beating out other studios including Sony and 20th Century Fox.,LOS ANGELES, July 10 NBCUniversal, cable giantComcast's Hollywood unit, has signed Thomas Tull,luring the producer behind big budget blockbusters such as "TheDark Knight" and "Man of Steel" away from Warner Brothers andbeating out other studios including Sony and 20thCentury Fox.

Title: Wagner takes control of Greenbrier Classic
Body: American Johnson Wagner moved a step closer to winning his fourth PGA Tour title by seizing a two-shot lead after Saturday's third round of the Greenbrier Classic at White Sulphur Springs in West Virginia.

Title: Third Point ups Sony stake, calls for independent entertainment board,US STOCKS-Wall St rises before Fed meeting to consider stimulus,US STOCKS-Wall Street to drift ahead of Fed meeting,UPDATE 2-Third Point ups Sony stake, calls for independent entertainment board,Nikkei rises, on track for longest winning run since May 23 selloff
Body: TOKYO New York-based hedge fund Third Point said it has raised its stake in Sony Corp and urged the Japanese company to create an independent board to run a partially spun-off entertainment arm with Sony's CEO, Kazuo Hirai, as its chairman. |¶ÿ,NEW YORK, June 18 U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday,led by growth-oriented sectors, as Federal Reserve policymakersgathered for a two-day meeting to discuss the future of theFed's bond-buying to stimulate the economy.,NEW YORK, June 18 U.S. stocks were set to tickup at the open on Tuesday ahead of the start of ahighly-anticipated Federal Reserve meeting.,TOKYO, June 18 New York-based hedge fund ThirdPoint said it has raised its stake in Sony Corp andurged the Japanese company to create an independent board to runa partially spun-off entertainment arm with Sony's CEO, KazuoHirai, as its chairman.,* Nikkei and Topix both up 0.6 pct    * Sony rises after hedge fund ups stake, presses spin-off    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, June 18 Japan's Nikkei rose on Tuesday,heading for a third straight day of gains, which will mark itslongest winning run since a sharp selloff on May 23, underpinnedby hopes the Federal Reserve will reinforce its commitment tosupport the U.S. economy.    Sony Corp climbed 3.6 percent after New York-basedhedge fund company Third Point said it had raised

Title: UPDATE 1-U.S., Japanese stocks boosts Loeb's Third Point fund
Body: NEW YORK, July 29 Bets on U.S and Japanesestocks helped Daniel Loeb's hedge fund,  Third Point, gain 3.3percent during the second quarter, even as equity and bondmarkets suffered rapid sell offs in June, the manager told hisinvestors on Monday.

Title: George Clooney takes aim at Sony investor Loeb over spin-off plan,Nikkei posts biggest rise in 5 weeks; US growth optimism, weaker yen buoy,Fitch: Sony's Core Electronics Business Remains Fragile,REFILE-Nikkei hits 1-wk high on Wall St, dovish central banks; Sony, Sharp rise,Sharp shares jump after it posts first-quarter profit, Sony hits one-week high
Body: LOS ANGELES Actor-producer George Clooney criticized the growing influence of hedge fund head Daniel Loeb, a big Sony Corp shareholder who wants the conglomerate to spin off part of its entertainment division.,TOKYO, Aug 2 Japan's Nikkei share average surged3.3 percent, its biggest one-day rise in five weeks, helped by arally in global markets after strong U.S. economic data, aweaker yen and some upbeat earnings reports from companies likeSony Corp.    The benchmark Nikkei was up 460.39 points at14,466.16, finishing above 14,400 for the first time since July25. It advanced 2.4 percent on the week after losing 3.2 percentin the prior week.    The broader Topix climbed 2.8 percent t,(The following statement was released by the rating agency)HONG KONG/SYDNEY/SINGAPORE, August 01 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings saysSony Corporation's (Sony, BB-/Negative) return to profit for thefirst quarter of the financial year ending March 2014 (FYE14) is a step towardsachieving long-term profitability. However, profitability in its core electronicsbusiness remains weak and, in Fitch's view, remains fragile to competitivepressure and exchange rate risk. Fitch would look for Sony to reclai,* Nikkei highest since July 26, up above 25-day movingaverage    * Sony, Sharp shine on 1Q profits    * Toyota earnings, U.S. jobs data in focus later on Friday    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Aug 2 Japan's Nikkei share average roseto a one-week high on Friday morning, spurred by Wall Street'srecord-close overnight on strong U.S. economic data and thecommitment by major central banks to keep monetary stimulus inplace.    A stronger dollar versus the yen also buoyed sentiment,TOKYO Shares in Sharp Corp  jumped 5.1 percent to 432 yen on Friday morning after the display panel maker eked out an operating profit in the first quarter ended on June 30, an early turnaround from last year's loss.

Title: Sony rejects Third Point's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,UPDATE 1-Sony rejects Third Point's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,Sony board votes to keep entertainment unit, rejects Loeb proposal,Sony rejects Third Point's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,Sony board votes to keep entertainment unit, rejects Loeb proposal
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp rejected on Tuesday a proposal from activist shareholder Daniel Loeb to spin off a part of the electronics company's entertainment business.,TOKYO, Aug 6 Japan's Sony Corp rejectedon Tuesday a proposal from activist shareholder Daniel Loeb tospin off a part of the electronics company's entertainmentbusiness.,Sony Corp's board voted unanimously not to sell its entertainment unit, rejecting a proposal from hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb, the company said in a statement on Monday.,TOKYO, Aug 6 Sony Corp rejected onTuesday U.S. hedge fund Third Point's proposal to spin off itspart of its entertainment business.,Aug 5 Sony Corp's board votedunanimously not to sell its entertainment unit, rejecting aproposal from hedge fund manager Daniel Loeb, the company saidin a statement on Monday.

Title: Loeb wants Sony to lay out specific goals for entertainment unit,Sony rejects Loeb's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,RPT-UPDATE 3-Sony rejects Loeb's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,UPDATE 3-Sony rejects Loeb's proposal to spin off entertainment unit,Nikkei rebounds on short-covering, yen; Sony tumbles,Third Point says to keep talking with Sony, explore options,Third Point says to keep talking with Sony, explore options,Sony falls after it rejects Loeb's entertainment spin-off proposal,Nikkei falls for 2nd day on exporters; Sony sags after rejecting fund plan,Sony falls after it rejects Loeb's entertainment spin-off proposal
Body: NEW YORK, Aug 6 Hedge fund manager Daniel Loebexpects Sony Corp to lay out a specific improvementplan and set financial targets for its entertainment businessbefore the company's annual general meeting next May, accordingto a source close to the hedge fund.,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp on Tuesday rejected a proposal from activist shareholder Daniel Loeb to partially spin off its entertainment business but the billionaire investor vowed to keep talking with the company and to explore other options. |¶ÿ,* Sony says spinoff plan would hinder synergies betweencontent, hardware,* Sony says spinoff plan would hinder synergies betweencontent, hardware,TOKYO, Aug 6 Japan's Nikkei share average rose 1percent on Tuesday as Reuters story that a Japanese pension fundmight buy more stocks and the yen's retreat sparkedshort-covering in a holiday-thin trade.    The benchmark Nikkei gained 143.02 points to14,401.06, after dropping as low as 14,031.61, while the broaderTopix rose 0.8 percent to 1,193.66 in thin trade, with2.26 billion shares changing hands.    Sony Corp was one of the notable losers, falling4.6 percent and was the ,TOKYO New York-based hedge fund Third Point, led by billionaire Daniel Loeb, said on Tuesday it would continue talking with Sony Corp and explore further options after the electronics maker's board rejected a proposal to partially list its entertainment arm.,TOKYO, Aug 6 New York-based hedge fund ThirdPoint, led by billionaire Daniel Loeb, said on Tuesday it wouldcontinue talking with Sony Corp and explore furtheroptions after the electronics maker's board rejected a proposalto partially list its entertainment arm.,TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp dropped 3 percent to 2,073 yen ($21.03) on Tuesday after the Japanese consumer electronics firm rejected proposals from activist shareholder Daniel Loeb to spin off a part of its entertainment business.,* Volume likely to stay thin - analysts    * Strong yen hurts exporters    * Company earnings overall good - Mizuho Securities    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Aug 6 Japan's Nikkei share average fellfor a second day on Tuesday,  on the yen's strength against thedollar, while Sony Corp tumbled after rejectingproposals from a U.S. fund to spin off a part of itsentertainment business.    Exporters took a hit, with Toyota Motor Corp falling 1.6 percent and Honda Motor Co shedding,TOKYO, Aug 6 Shares in Sony Corp dropped 3 percent to 2,073 yen ($21.03) on Tuesday after theJapanese consumer electronics firm rejected proposals fromactivist shareholder Daniel Loeb to spin off a part of itsentertainment business.

Title: Exclusive: DoCoMo to select Sony, Sharp, Fujitsu for new smartphone lineup - sources,UPDATE 1-DoCoMo to select Sony, Sharp, Fujitsu for new smartphone lineup-sources,DoCoMo to select Sony, Sharp, Fujitsu for winter smartphone lineup -sources
Body: TOKYO NTT DoCoMo Inc , Japan's largest mobile operator, will select Sony Corp , Sharp Corp  and Fujitsu Ltd  smartphone models for its main winter product lineup, sources familiar with the situation said.,* Sharp and Fujitsu added to lineup, Sony retained, Samsungexcluded - sources,TOKYO, Aug 14 NTT DoCoMo Inc, Japan'slargest mobile operator, will select Sony Corp, SharpCorp and Fujitsu Ltd smartphone models for itsmain winter product lineup, sources familiar with the situationsaid.

Title: Pegatron sees non-PC revenue rising up to 50 percent in third quarter,Pegatron sees non-PC revenue rising up to 50 percent in Q3
Body: TAIPEI Taiwanese contract manufacturer Pegatron Corp sees revenue in its communications and consumer electronics segments growing 40-50 percent in the third quarter compared to the last as it ramps up shipments for major clients like Apple Inc and Sony Corp.,TAIPEI, Aug 12 Taiwanese contract manufacturerPegatron Corp sees revenue in its communications andconsumer electronics segments growing 40-50 percent in the thirdquarter compared to the last as it ramps up shipments for majorclients like Apple Inc and Sony Corp.

Body: Sony Corp is close to striking a deal to secure content from media company Viacom for a new Internet-based TV service, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.,Aug 15 Sony Corp is close to striking adeal to secure content from media company Viacom for anew Internet-based TV service, the Wall Street Journal reportedon Thursday.

Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said its electronics division faces hard times ahead even after a weak yen helped pull it into profit for the first time in two years, ratcheting up pressure on the board to respond to activist shareholder Daniel Loeb's proposal to split the company in two. |¶ÿ,* Sony Q1 oper profit 36.4 bln yen vs analyst forecast 25.3bln,Aug 1 (Reuters)-           Sony Corp           CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS                    3 months ended      3 months ended       Year to                   Jun 30, 2013        Jun 30, 2012     Mar 31, 2014                      LATEST             YEAR-AGO          COMPANY                        RESULTS             RESULT          FORECAST     Sales             1.71 trln           1.52 trln        7.90 trln                     (+13.0 pct)          (+1.4 pct)      (+16.2 pct)  ,TOKYO, Aug 1 Japan's Sony Corp said onThursday that its board is still discussing proposals from hedgefund Third Point to spin off the group's money-makingentertainment arm to free up cash to revive the electronicsbusiness.,TOKYO, Aug 1 Sony Corp said on Thursdayit lowered its TV sales forecast for the year ending in March2014 by 6.3 percent to 15 million units, down from a previousestimate of 16 million.

Title: 'One Direction' edges 'Butler', sings its way to box office win,'One Direction' edges 'Butler', sings its way to box office win
Body: LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK Concert film "One Direction: This is Us," a Sony Pictures/TriStar release featuring the red-hot British boy band One Direction, won the weekend box office race with ticket sales of $17 million, edging the civil rights drama "Lee Daniels' The Butler" which had been the top film for the past two weeks.,LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK, Sept 1Concert film "OneDirection: This is Us," a Sony Pictures/TriStar release featuring the red-hot British boy band One Direction, won theweekend box office race with ticket sales of $17 million, edgingthe civil rights drama "Lee Daniels' The Butler" which had ledfor the past two weeks.

Title: Third Point to put Sony shares under own name - Nikkei
Body: Sept 21 Activist investor Daniel Loeb's ThirdPoint LLC will re-register a chunk of its shares in Sony Corp under its own name, allowing the hedge fund group tofile shareholder resolutions and take other steps to push forbetter management, the Nikkei reported, quoting people familiarwith the matter.

Title: Sony bets on initial PS4 sales outstripping predecessor by 40 percent,UPDATE 2-Sony bets on initial PS4 sales outstripping predecessor by 40 percent,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Sony aims to sell 5 mln PS4 consoles in less than 5 months from launch,Sony aims to sell 5 mln PS4 consoles in 2013/14
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp is betting on initial Playstation 4 sales to be 40 percent higher than its last home game console which cost more to build and buy, raising the prospect of quicker return to help revive its consumer electronics business.,* Sony targets Playstation 4 sales of 5 million units byMarch-end,(Corrects PS3 sales figure to 3.6 million from 5.5 million inparagraph 2),TOKYO, Sept 19 Sony Corp aims to sell 5million of its new PlayStation 4 game consoles worldwide in thefinancial year to March 31, 2014, Sony's game unit chief, AndrewHouse, said during a presentation at the Tokyo Game Show onThursday.

Title: In Panasonic's plasma exit, Japan's TV makers come to terms with defeat
Body: TOKYO Panasonic Corp's move to close its last plasma television factory completes a painful reckoning that has all but killed off Japan's TV industry, once the pride of the country's post-war rise to technological and economic power.

Body: Oct 30 Chipmaker Intel Corp is havingsecond thoughts about its nascent television service and is intalks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over the business,according to a report on tech website All Things D, citingpeople familiar with the matter.

Body: Nov 19 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media:,Nov 19 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media:

Title: Best Buy sees strong demand for Sony's PS4 gaming console: CEO,CORRECTED (OFFICIAL)-Best Buy sees strong demand for Sony's PS4 gaming console -CEO
Body: NEW YORK Best Buy Co Inc has seen high demand for the Sony PS4 gaming console and at one New York City location it had sold out, the retailer's chief executive said on Thursday.,(Company corrects to say Best Buy has not run out of PS4 at allstores, headline, paragraph 1)

Title: UPDATE 1-Microsoft sells over a million Xbox Ones in under 24 hours
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 22 Microsoft Corp sold over 1 million of its new Xbox One game consoles within 24hours of their hitting store shelves on Friday, on par with SonyCorp's PlayStation 4 despite launching in far morecountries.

Title: Best Buy has 'pretty much run out' of Sony PS4: retailer's CEO,Best Buy has 'pretty much run out' of Sony PS4 -retailer's CEO,UPDATE 2-Sony says to make fewer films as it shifts to television,Sony says to make fewer films as it shifts to televison,UPDATE 3-GameStop's profit forecast disappoints, shares fall,Sony to make fewer films, make "significant" TV push -executives,Microsoft hopes Xbox One finally puts it on the media map
Body: NEW YORK Best Buy Co Inc has "pretty much run out" of the new PlayStation 4 gaming console, the retailer's chief executive said on Thursday.,NEW YORK, Nov 21 Best Buy Co Inc has"pretty much run out" of the new PlayStation 4 gaming console,the retailer's chief executive said on Thursday.,Nov 21 Sony's Pictures Entertainment willproduce fewer films as it makes a "significant" shift frommotion pictures to higher-margin television production and tooperating TV channels, Sony Corp  executivestold investors gathered at the company's Culver City,California, studio lot.,Sony's Pictures Entertainment will produce fewer films going forward as it makes a "significant" shift from motion pictures to higher-margin television production and to operating TV channels, Sony Corp executives told investors gathered at the company's Culver City, California, studio lot.,Nov 21 GameStop Corp forecastworse-than-expected earnings for the crucial holiday quarter,dashing hopes that new game consoles from Sony Corp andMicrosoft Corp will fire up sales for the U.S.videogames retailer.,Nov 21 Sony's Pictures Entertainment willproduce fewer films going forward, making a "significant shiftfrom motion pictures to higher margin television production andnetworks," Sony Corp executives told investors gatheredat the company's Culver City, California studio lot.,SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 21 Microsoft Corp aims to upstage rival Sony Corp  with a consolethat goes well beyond gaming and helps transform media viewing,a long-cherished but elusive goal.

Title: Sony may buy Renesas plant to boost smartphone sensor output: sources,UPDATE 1-Sony may buy Renesas plant to boost smartphone sensor output-sources,Sony may buy Renesas plant to boost sensor production-sources
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp may buy a Japanese factory from chipmaker Renesas Electronics Corp to boost production of its imaging sensors as demand rises from smartphone makers, sources told Reuters on Wednesday.,TOKYO, Dec 4 Sony Corp may buy aJapanese factory from chipmaker Renesas Electronics Corp to boost production of its imaging sensors as demandrises from smartphone makers, sources told Reuters on Wednesday.,TOKYO, Dec 4 Sony Corp may buy afactory from chipmaker Renesas Electronics Corp boostproduction of its imaging sensors to meet rising demand fromChinese smartphone makers, sources told Reuters on Wednesday.

Title: Sony says PS4 global sales exceed 2.1 million units
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Tuesday that global sales of its PlayStation 4 game console exceeded 2.1 million units as of December 1.

Title: Microsoft says Xbox One global sales top 2 million,UPDATE 1-Microsoft says Xbox One global sales top 2 million,BBC appoints former Sony boss as embarks on management revamp,Microsoft says Xbox One global sales top 2 million units
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Microsoft Corp has sold more than 2 million Xbox One video game consoles since its November 22 launch, catching up with rival Sony Corp's PlayStation 4 released a week earlier.,SAN FRANCISCO, Dec 11 Microsoft Corp has sold more than 2 million Xbox One video game consoles sinceits Nov. 22 launch, catching up with rival Sony Corp's PlayStation 4 released a week earlier.,LONDON, Dec 11 After a year of turbulence, theBBC unveiled plans for a management shake-up on Wednesday tohelp restore confidence in Britain's publicly fundedbroadcaster, starting with the appointment of ex-Sony CEO andCBS president Howard Stringer.,SAN FRANCISCO, Dec 11 Microsoft Corp has sold more than 2 million Xbox One video game consoles sinceits Nov. 22 launch, catching up with rival Sony Corp's PlayStation 4 released a week earlier.

Title: Beyonce surprises fans with release of album,Singer Beyonce surprises fans with unheralded album release
Body: NEW YORK U.S. pop singer Beyonce surprised fans and critics with the release of her fifth solo studio album on Friday, which features 14 new songs and 17 videos and generated a frenzy on Twitter. |¶ÿ,Dec 13 U.S. pop singer Beyonce trumped fans byreleasing an unheralded self-titled fifth solo studio album onFriday featuring 14 new songs and 17 videos, her label ColumbiaRecords, a division of Sony, said.

Title: Sony home entertainment chief to leave studio in March,Sony home entertainment chief to leave studio in March
Body: David Bishop, the president of home entertainment at Sony Corp's Sony Pictures, will leave the company in March, the latest departure as the studio revamps its operations after criticism from hedge fund investor Daniel Loeb.,Dec 18 David Bishop, the president of homeentertainment at Sony Corp's Sony Pictures, will leavethe company in March, the latest departure as the studio revampsits operations after criticism from hedge fund investor DanielLoeb.

Title: UPDATE 1-New Zealand/Australia Morning Call-Global markets,RPT-New Zealand/Australia Morning Call-Global markets,New Zealand/Australia Morning Call-Global markets
Sony to give up on sale of its battery unit: media,Sony to give up on sale of its battery unit - media
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp has decided not to sell its lithium-ion battery unit, media reported on Sunday, in a gamble that it can turn the business around with a weak yen and growing demand for smart phone batteries.,TOKYO, Dec 29 Japan's Sony Corp hasdecided not to sell its lithium-ion battery unit, media reportedon Sunday, in a gamble that it can turn the business around witha weak yen and growing demand for smart phone batteries.

Title: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
Body: Dec 30 The following bids, mergers, acquisitionsand disposals were reported by 1100 GMT on Monday:

Title: Sony, Panasonic say to end joint OLED TV development
Body: TOKYO, Dec 25 Sony Corp and PanasonicCorp, Japan's two largest consumer electronicscompanies, said on Wednesday that they will end jointdevelopment of organic light emitting diode (OLED) televisionscreens, a thinner and brighter type of next-generation displayin which Korean rivals have a head-start.

Title: Nintendo shares surge as China eases gaming console ban
Body: TOKYO, Jan 8 Shares in Nintendo Co Ltd jumped as much as 6 percent to a 2-1/2 year high on Wednesdayafter China temporarily lifted a 14-year-old ban on sellingvideo game consoles.

Title: Sony to test PlayStation-based cloud TV service,UPDATE 2-Sony to test PlayStation-based cloud TV service,Sony says sold 4.2 mln PS4 game consoles as of Dec. 28,China suspends ban on video game consoles after more than a decade,UPDATE 2-China suspends ban on video game consoles after more than a decade
Body: LAS VEGAS Sony Corp will begin testing a new television service that combines traditional viewing with on-demand content through its PlayStation gaming system, a cloud-based service could possibly change long-established cable and media industry relationships.,LAS VEGAS, Jan 7 Sony Corp will begintesting a new television service that combines traditionalviewing with on-demand content through its PlayStation gamingsystem, a cloud-based service could possibly changelong-established cable and media industry relationships.,LAS VEGAS, Jan 7 Sony Corp has sold 4.2million Playstation 4 game consoles as of Dec. 28, a seniorexecutive said on Tuesday, surpassing the 3 million MicrosoftCorp Xbox One devices sold as of end-2013.,BEIJING China has temporarily lifted a 14-year-old ban on selling video game consoles, paving the way for Sony Corp, Microsoft Corp and Nintendo Co Ltd to enter the world's third largest video game market in terms of revenue.,* China video game mkt third-largest by revenue, worth $14billion

Title: Nintendo heads for third consecutive annual loss as Wii U flops
Body: TOKYO Nintendo Co Ltd said on Friday that sales of its Wii U consoles had flopped, pushing it to a third consecutive annual loss and raising a question mark over its future in a home console market increasingly dominated by Sony Corp and Microsoft Corp.

Title: Xbox One sales top 3 million, no new Sony data,Xbox One sales top 3 million, no new Sony data
Body: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp said on Monday that sales of its new Xbox One game console topped three million at the end of last year after launching in November.,SEATTLE, Jan 6 Microsoft Corp said onMonday that sales of its new Xbox One game console topped threemillion at the end of last year after launching in November.

Title: Japan's Nikkei edges higher, Tokyo Steel jumps
Body: TOKYO, Jan 22 The Nikkei stock average eked outmodest gains on Wednesday, with Tokyo Steel Manufacturing Co Ltd jumping after a robust earnings report.     The Nikkei ended 0.2 percent higher at 15,820.96after trading as low as 15,631.41 following a BOJ decision tokeep monetary policy steady. A trader said some investors hadbeen hoping that the BOJ might further ease this time.     The BOJ also maintained its upbeat inflation forecasts,suggesting that no imminent monetary eas

Title: Nikkei tumbles 1.5 pct, Sony posts best day since June,Sony shares climb to one-month high on report of smartphone push
Body: * Nikkei largely gives up Wednesday's 1.9 pct bounce    * Sony marks biggest one-day percentage rise since June    By Dominic Lau    TOKYO, Jan 9 Japan's Nikkei stock average shed1.5 percent on Thursday after the previous session's bounce, asinvestors stayed risk averse ahead of a key U.S. jobs report thefollowing day.    The Nikkei ended 241.12 points lower at 15,880.33after climbing 1.9 percent on Wednesday to snap losses on thefirst two trading days of 2014. Tokyo stock ,TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp rose as much as 5.2 percent to a one-month high on Thursday after media reports said the consumer electronics company aimed to double its smartphone sales volume in two years.

Title: New consoles boost Christmas sales at retailer Game
Body: LONDON Game, a video games retailer bought out of administration by private equity investors last year, reported a significant rise in Christmas sales helped by new console launches ahead of a possible return to the stock market.

Title: Moody's cuts Sony debt rating to junk status, citing TV, PC woes,Update-Moody's cuts Sony's rating to Ba1/Not Prime; outlook stable
Body: TOKYO, Jan 27 Moody's Investors Service cut SonyCorp's debt rating to junk status on Monday,highlighting challenges in its television and PC businesses andpressure on profitability at its entire core consumerelectronics operation.,Sony Corporation

Title: Sony, Lenovo in talks on possible PC business alliance: report,Sony, Lenovo in talks on possible PC business alliance - report
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp and Chinese technology company Lenovo Group are in talks about a possible joint venture to take over Sony's loss-making Vaio PC business overseas, Japanese broadcaster NHK reported on Saturday.,TOKYO, Feb 1 Japan's Sony Corp andChinese technology company Lenovo Group are in talksabout a possible joint venture to take over Sony's loss-makingVaio PC business overseas, Japanese broadcaster NHK reported onSaturday.

Title: Update-Moody's:Sony takes major measures to reform PC and TV businesses -- a credit positive first step,Nikkei jumps 2 pct on optimism ahead of U.S. jobs report,Sony climbs to 2-week high after announcing TV spinoff plan
Body: For the full text of this story please click the followinglink:,* Nikkei above 200-day average for first time in 4 days    * Foreigners seen buying back after Japan sharesunderperformed    * Sony jumps 5 pct on restructuring plan    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Feb 7 Japan's Nikkei average jumped 2percent on Friday morning, moving away from a four-month low hitearlier this week, as investor sentiment was brightened by arally on Wall Street and hopes for an upbeat U.S. jobs reportlater in the day.    The Nikkei was up 1.7 percent at 14,40,TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp  climbed as much as 4.6 percent to a two-week high of 1,699 yen on Friday morning after the Japanese firm said it is spinning off its loss-making TV division in the latest attempt to revive its fortunes.

Title: As losses mount, Sony's Hirai seeks cure for TV business in spinoff,Sony CEO says no plan to immediately sell off TV unit,UPDATE 2-As losses mount, Sony's Hirai seeks cure for TV business in spinoff,Sony to cut 5,000 jobs, split off PC, TV operations,Sony CEO says no plan to immediately sell off TV unit,REFILE-TABLE-Sony -9-MTH group results (SEC),Sony forecasts net loss for fiscal year as restructuring costs rise,Sony to cut 5,000 jobs, split off PC, TV operations
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp Chief Executive Offer Kazuo Hirai is seeking to cure a TV business that has lost $7.8 billion over a decade by isolating it to speed up decisions on future strategy. |¶ÿ,TOKYO Body: TOKYO Sony Corp is in talks with investment fund Japan Industrial Partners to sell its loss-making Vaio personal computer division, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.,TOKYO, Feb 5 Sony Corp is in talks withinvestment fund Japan Industrial Partners to sell itsloss-making Vaio personal computer division, a source familiarwith the matter said on Wednesday.,TOKYO, Feb 5 Sony Corp is in talks withinvestment fund Japan Industrial Partners to sell itsloss-making Vaio personal computer division, a source familiarwith the matter said on Wednesday.,(Adds Volkswagen, Sony, SolarCity, Versace, Atlantia,Investindustrial),Sony Corp is in talks to sell its poorly performing personal computer business to investment fund Japan Industrial Partners for up to 50 billion yen ($490 million), the Nikkei daily reported.,Feb 5 Sony Corp is in talks to sell itspoorly performing personal computer business to investment fundJapan Industrial Partners for up to 50 billion yen ($490million), the Nikkei daily reported.,Shares plunge as U.S. slowdown adds to emerging market woes,HONG KONG Shares in Lenovo Group Ltd slumped more than 16 percent on Tuesday after a weekend media report said the Chinese personal computer maker was in talks with Sony Corp about a possible joint venture to buy Sony's loss-making Vaio PC business outside Japan.,* Lenovo declines comment on media report (Adds Lenovo declining comment, analyst, share close),HONG KONG, Feb 4 Lenovo Group Ltd declined to comment on a weekend media report that the Chinesepersonal computer maker was in talks with Japan's Sony Corp about a possible joint venture to buy Sony'sloss-making Vaio PC business overseas.

Title: Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest
Body: Feb 3 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media:

Title: S&P cuts Sony credit rating one notch to BBB-, outlook negative
Body: TOKYO, Feb 14 Standard & Poor's cut itslong-term credit rating on Sony Corp one notch to BBB-,just above junk status, citing the electronics division'sdeclining competitiveness in an increasingly competitiveindustry and a slower-than-expected recovery in profitability.

Title: Sony to buy chip factory from Japan's Renesas for up to 8 bln yen -sources,Nikkei edges up from 2-month low but Apple suppliers sag,Sony falls 3.3 percent to two-month low, Moody's cuts debt rating to junk
Body: TOKYO, Jan 28 Sony Corp will buy afactory from Japanese chipmaker Renesas Electronics Corp for 7 billion to 8 billion yen ($68 million to $78million) to ramp up production of imaging sensors, sources toldReuters on Tuesday, as demand for smartphones grows.,* Komatsu rises on strong Caterpillar results    * Apple suppliers take hit on weak guidance    * Sony falls after Moody's cut debt rating to 'junk'    * Fed meeting, U.S. data in focus    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Jan 28 Japan's Nikkei average edged up onTuesday, clawing back some ground from a two-month low hit theprevious day as investors scooped up bargains, whileconstruction equipment makers like Komatsu jumped afterCaterpillar reported upbeat results.    Bucking the,TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp  shed 3.3 percent to a two-month low of 1,654 yen after Moody's Investors Service cut its debt rating on the Japanese consumer electronics company to junk status, citing challenges in its television and PC businesses.

Title: UPDATE 1-Third Point no longer in list of top 10 Sony shareholders,Third Point no longer listed among top 10 Sony shareholders,Sony sells 5.3 million Playstation consoles, exceeds full-year target,Sony sells 5.3 mln Playstation consoles, exceeds full-year target
Body: * Third Point called for spin off of Sony entertainment arm,TOKYO, Feb 18 Activist hedge fund investorDaniel Loeb's Third Point, which called for major reforms atSony Corp after acquiring a stake, is no longer listedamong the electronics maker's 10 biggest shareholders, aregulatory filing showed.,TOKYO Sony Corp said it has sold 5.3 million Playstation 4 game consoles as of February 8, surpassing its full-year target ahead of its release in Japan next week.,TOKYO, Feb 18 Sony Corp said it hassold 5.3 million Playstation 4 game consoles as of Feb. 8,surpassing its full-year target ahead of its release in Japannext week.

Title: Sony in talks to supply more camera sensors to Apple: Nikkei,Sony in talks to supply more camera sensors to Apple - Nikkei
Body: Sony Corp is in talks with Apple Inc to double its supply of camera components for a new iPhone slated to roll out as early as next year, the Nikkei reported.,Feb 12 Sony Corp is in talks with AppleInc to double its supply of camera components for a newiPhone slated to roll out as early as next year, the Nikkeireported.

Title: Nikkei climbs to 1-1/2 week high; Nissan, Sony shine
Body: * Nissan soars as investors cover short positions - traders    * Sony rises on Apple supply report    * Weak machinery orders data limit overall gains - analysts    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Feb 12 Japan's Nikkei share averageclimbed to a 1-1/2 week high on Wednesday after the FederalReserve's new chief held off from making any changes to itsstimulus-reduction schedule and as a softer yen supportedexporters like Canon Inc.    Nissan Motor Co outperformed with traders citin

Body: * Sony in talks to sell Vaio Japan business to fund -source,TOKYO Sony Corp is in talks with investment fund Japan Industrial Partners to sell its loss-making Vaio personal computer division, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday. |¶ÿ,Feb 5 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media:,Feb 5 The following corporate finance-relatedstories were reported by media:,* Nikkei up 1.4 pct, Topix up 2 pct    * Dips this week created buying opportunities - traders    * Sony gains on talks to sell loss-making PC business    By Ayai Tomisawa    TOKYO, Feb 5 The Nikkei average climbed morethan 1 percent on Wednesday, bouncing from a four-month low hitthe previous day, as investors scooped up recently batteredstocks like Panasonic and Toyota Motor following strong earningsresults.    Panasonic Corp jumped more than 15 percent and wasthe fifth-,TOKYO Shares in Sony Corp  jumped nearly 8 percent to a one-week high of 1,650 yen on Wednesday morning after news that it is in talks with Japan Industrial Partners to sell its loss-making Vaio personal computer business.

Title: Sony to shutter 20 retail stores in the U.S.,UPDATE 1-Sony to shutter 20 retail stores in the U.S.,Sony to shutter 20 retail stores in the U.S.
Body: Sony Corp's electronic unit said on Wednesday it is closing 20 retail stores in the United States and cutting 1,000 jobs, as the TV and game console maker tries to stem losses and regain market share.,Feb 26 Sony Corp's  electronicunit said on Wednesday it is closing 20 retail stores in theUnited States and cutting 1,000 jobs, as the TV and game consolemaker tries to stem losses and regain market share.,Feb 26 Sony Corp's  electronicunit said on Wednesday it is closing 20 retail stores in theUnited States and cutting 1,000 jobs, as the TV and game consolemaker tries to stem losses and regain market share.

Title: Sony says has sold 6 million PlayStation 4s as of March 2
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Tuesday that it has sold 6 million PlayStation 4 game consoles as of March 2, well ahead of its target for the fiscal year to the end of this month.

Title: Sony to release new DVD/CD of legendary Bob Dylan tribute concert,Sony to release new DVD/CD of legendary Bob Dylan tribute concert
Body: NEW YORK In the fall of 1992, a group of music industry legends converged on New York City to pay tribute to Bob Dylan by performing his songs at a concert that has come to be seen as one of the most exciting in rock history.,NEW YORK, March 3 In the fall of 1992, a groupof music industry legends converged on New York City to paytribute to Bob Dylan by performing his songs at a concert thathas come to be seen as one of the most exciting in rock history.

Title: Sony to release new DVD/CD of legendary Bob Dylan tribute concert,Sony to release new DVD/CD of legendary Bob Dylan tribute concert
