Title: PlayStation 4 sales help Sony swing to Q2 operating profit,UPDATE 1-PlayStation 4 sales help Sony swing to Q2 operating profit,Sony videogame sales help it swing to Q2 operating profit
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp swung to a second-quarter operating profit as strong PlayStation 4 videogame sales helped to offset a fall in smartphone sales and keep the company on a recovery track after years of decline in its consumer electronics business.,* Strong PlayStation 4 software & sensors sales offset weakmobile (Adds CFO comments from conference and details of results),TOKYO, Oct 29 Sony Corp swung onThursday to a quarterly operating profit as strong videogamesales helped to offset a fall in smartphone sales and as theyear-ago quarter had seen a big impairment charge.

Title: Third Point buys stake in Japan's Seven & I - sources
Body: TOKYO, Oct 27 U.S. hedge fund Third Point hasbought a stake in Seven & I Holdings and wants theJapanese retailer to downsize its general merchandise businessto improve profitability, sources with knowledge of the mattersaid.

Title: Lawyer's 'medical issue' doomed Shakira copyright case, Mayimba Music says,Sony starts making premium smartphones in Thailand, in quest for profits
Body: The dispute over whether a hit song by pop star Shakira wasan illegal copy of a Dominican songwriter's work has takenanother dramatic turn now that the music company behind thelawsuit says its former attorney has a "deteriorating" medicalcondition and failed to represent it properly.,BANGKOK, Nov 5 Japan's Sony Corp aimsto make 600,000 to 700,000 premium smartphones in the first yearat its new wholly-owned plant in Thailand which began productionin September, a spokesman said.

Title: UPDATE 1-Third Point buys stake in Japan's Seven & I - sources
Body: TOKYO, Oct 27 Third Point has bought a stake inretailer Seven & I Holdings, sources with knowledge ofthe matter said on Tuesday, the latest investment in Japan forthe U.S. hedge fund run by billionaire investor Daniel Loeb.

Title: Toshiba to sell sensor business to Sony for around $165 million: sources,UPDATE 1-Toshiba to sell sensor business to Sony for around $165 mln-sources
Body: TOKYO Toshiba Corp is set to sell its image sensor business to Sony Corp for around 20 billion yen ($164.68 million) as part of a restructuring plan laid out earlier this year, sources with knowledge of the deal said on Saturday.,TOKYO, Oct 24 Toshiba Corp is set tosell its image sensor business to Sony Corp for around20 billion yen ($164.68 million) as part of a restructuring planlaid out earlier this year, sources with knowledge of the dealsaid on Saturday.

Title: Louisiana-Lafayette 23, Georgia State 21
Body: Georgia State couldn't hold a fourth-quarter lead for the second straight week and lost to Louisiana-Lafayette 23-21 Saturday in Sun Belt Conference play at the Georgia Dome.

Title: Georgia 23, Georgia Southern 17 (OT)
Body: Sony Michel scored on a 25-yard run in overtime, helping Georgia survive a stern test from Georgia Southern in a 23-17 victory on Saturday at Samford Stadium in Athens, Georgia.

Title: Georgia Southern 55, South Alabama 17
Body: Georgia Southern running back Matt Breida rushed for 187 yards and two touchdowns, leading the Eagles to a 55-17 win over visiting South Alabama on Saturday.

Title: Kellogg, Sony and others sign up to emissions goals,Kellogg, Sony and others sign up to emissions goals
Body: PARIS/BERLIN Kellogg , Sony , Coca-Cola Enterprises  and a group of other companies have committed to targets certified by independent assessors to cut their carbon emissions, they said on Tuesday.,PARIS/BERLIN, Dec 8 Kellogg, Sony, Coca-Cola Enterprises and a group of othercompanies have committed to targets certified by independentassessors to cut their carbon emissions, they said on Tuesday.

Title: Toshiba, Fujitsu and Vaio mulling PC units merger - Nikkei
Body: Dec 3 Japanese electronic companies Toshiba Corp, Fujitsu Ltd and Sony Corp spinoffVaio are mulling a combination of their PC operations, accordingto a Nikkei report.

Title: Sony's PlayStation 4 sales top 30 million consoles,Sony's PlayStation 4 sales top 30 million consoles
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp on Wednesday said sales of its PlayStation 4 video game console exceeded 30.2 million units as of Nov. 22, as global price cuts ahead of the year-end holiday season bolstered demand.,TOKYO, Nov 25 Sony Corp on Wednesdaysaid sales of its PlayStation 4 video game console exceeded 30.2million units as of Nov. 22, as global price cuts ahead of theyear-end holiday season bolstered demand.

Title: Sony to split off fast-growing image sensor business,UPDATE 1-Sony to split off fast-growing image sensor business,Sony to split off fast-growing image sensor business
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  said it will split off its semiconductors operations in a bid to bolster growth in devices such as image sensors, which have helped lead a turnaround at the Japanese electronics maker.,* Company eyes expansion of sensors into autos (Adds details on sensors business),TOKYO, Oct 6 Japan's Sony Corp said itwill split off its semiconductors operations to bolster growthin devices such as image sensors, which have emerged as thecompany's strongest products in recent years.

Title: Japan Display to produce OLED smartphone panels from 2018
Body: TOKYO, Jan 22 Japan Display Inc said itwill begin mass production of organic light emitting diode(OLED) panels in 2018, aiming to catch up with Korean rivalsamid speculation Apple Inc may adopt such screens forits iPhones soon.

Title: KKR, Bain, Fujifilm to bid for Japan's Toshiba Medical-sources
Body: TOKYO, Jan 27 U.S. buyout funds KKR & Co and Bain Capital, as well as Fujifilm Holdings Corp,are among potential bidders for a medical equipment unit offinancially troubled Toshiba Corp in a deal that couldfetch more than $3 billion, people familiar with the processsaid on Wednesday.

Title: Sony says bracing for smartphone slowdown after sensor sales dip,UPDATE 3-Sony says bracing for smartphone slowdown after sensor sales dip,CORRECTED-(OFFICIAL)-Sony says bracing for smartphone slowdown after sensor sales dip,Sony quarterly operating profit rises 11 pct, beats analyst estimates
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp , widely regarded as a key supplier of image sensors for Apple Inc's  iPhones, said on Friday it was bracing for a slowdown in the premium smartphone market after sales of its sensors fell in the third quarter.,* Keeps outlook for annual op profit at 320 bln yen (Adds raised outlook for game division),TOKYO, Jan 29 Sony Corp, widelyregarded as a key supplier of image sensors for Apple Inc's iPhones, said on Friday it was bracing for a slowdownin the premium smartphone market after sales of its sensors fellin the third quarter.,TOKYO, Jan 29 Sony Corp reported an 11percent rise in quarterly operating profit on Friday as strongsales of PlayStation 4 games helped offset a decline in sales ofimage sensors, which had led the company's turnaround in theprevious year.

Title: Sony says to buy Israel's Altair Semiconductor for $212 million
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  said it will buy Israeli chipmaker Altair Semiconductor for $212 million, stepping up its investment in chip technology after strong sales of camera sensors in the last few years helped turn around the business.

Title: U.S. judge refuses to revive Shakira copyright case, levies sanctions
Body: Calling its newest arguments "nonsense," a federal judge inManhattan refused to revive a New York music publisher's caseagainst Sony Corp over claims that a hit song by pop starShakira was an illegal copy of a Dominican songwriter's work.

Title: Quake stalls manufacturing in southern Japan; no major damage reported
Body: TOKYO Manufacturers including Honda Motor  and Sony Corp  halted production at plants in southwestern Japan on Friday to inspect for any damage from the previous night's earthquake. No major damage was reported.

Title: Sony to delay announcing earnings forecasts to assess quake damage
Body: TOKYO, April 22 Japanese electronics giant SonyCorp said on Friday it would delay announcing earningsforecasts for this business year as it continues to assess theimpact of the powerful earthquakes that have halted its imagesensor plant in southern Japan.

Title: Warner Music Group, indies want EU to be tough on Sony's Michael Jackson deal,Warner Music Group, indies want EU to be tough on Sony's Michael Jackson deal,Sony cuts FY 2015 profit estimate by 9.4 percent on weaker smartphone demand,UPDATE 1-Sony cuts FY 2015 profit estimate by 9.4 pct on weaker smartphone demand,Sony cuts FY2015 profit estimate on weaker camera modules demand
Body: BRUSSELS - Warner Music Group and independent labels have urged EU regulators to fight Sony Corp's bid to buy out Michael Jackson's stake in its music publishing joint venture, saying the move gives Sony too much power.,BRUSSELS, April 21 - Warner Music Group and independentlabels have urged EU regulators to fight Sony Corp's bid to buy out Michael Jackson's stake in its music publishingjoint venture, saying the move gives Sony too much power.,TOKYO Japanese electronics firm Sony Corp  cut its profit estimate by 9.4 percent for the financial year that ended in March, as slowing global smartphone sales dented demand for its camera modules.,* Books 59.6 bln yen impairment loss on camera modulebusiness,TOKYO, April 21 Japanese electronics firm SonyCorp cut its profit estimate for the financial yearthat ended in March, citing  weaker demand for its cameramodules used in smartphones.

Body: * Sony and jackson estate sign definitive agreement for sonyto acquire remaining half of sony/atv music publishing,TOKYO Sony Corp  said on Monday that its image sensor plant in Kumamoto, which has been shut since earthquakes hit southern Japan last week, makes components mainly for digital cameras.,TOKYO, April 18 Sony Corp said onMonday that its image sensor plant in Kumamoto, which has beenshut since earthquakes hit southern Japan last week, makescomponents mainly for digital cameras.,TOKYO, April 18 Japanese electronics giant SonyCorp said on Monday that its image sensor plant inKumamoto, which has been offline since deadly earthquakes hitsouthern Japan, produces mainly for digital cameras, rather thansmartphones as investors have feared.

Title: Sony extending closure of image sensor plant in quake-hit southern Japan,Sony extending closure of image sensor plant in quake-hit southern Japan
Body: TOKYO Electronics giant Sony Corp on Sunday said production at its image sensor plant in Kumamoto, southern Japan, remained suspended as it assessed damage from a powerful earthquake.,TOKYO, April 17 Electronics giant Sony Corp on Sunday said production at its image sensor plant inKumamoto, southern Japan, remained suspended as it assesseddamage from a powerful earthquake.

Title: UPDATE 2-Japan quakes disrupt Sony production of image sensors used in Apple iPhones
Body: TOKYO, April 16 Electronics giant Sony Corp said a factory producing image sensors for smartphonemakers will remain closed while it assesses the damage from twodeadly earthquakes which hit southern Japan. One of its majorcustomers is Apple, which uses the sensors in itsiPhones.

Title: Sony's sensor business slows even as cost cuts lift profit,UPDATE 3-Sony's sensor business slows even as cost cuts lift profit,BRIEF-Axis says supplier affected by Japanese earthquake, could have effect on sales,Sony logs biggest FY profit in 8 years on restructuring, games
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  on Thursday reported an annual loss in its image sensors business, raising fears the firm's revival of recent years may be losing momentum, even though cost cuts helped it book its biggest operating profit in eight years.,* Panasonic sees weaker profit ahead (Adds Sony's estimate on damage from quakes),* Japanese earthquake in mid April caused damages onsupplier Sony's sensor manufacturing plant.,TOKYO, April 28 Japanese electronics maker SonyCorp on Thursday reported its biggest annual operatingprofit since fiscal 2007, due to restructuring its strugglingsmartphone business and brisk demand for PlayStation 4videogames.

Title: UPDATE 3-Madonna, Kesha, Dion rule the stage at emotional Billboard Awards
Body: May 22 Madonna paid tribute to Prince, Keshaearned a standing ovation for her stirring rendition of "ItAin't Me, Babe" honoring Bob Dylan, and Celine Dion dedicatedher Icon award to her late husband at Sunday night'semotion-packed Billboard Music Awards.

Title: Nikkei hits near 1-month high on weaker yen; Sony soars on outlook,Nikkei rebounds on weaker yen; Sony soars on growth outlook
Body: TOKYO, May 25 Japanese stocks rose to a nearone-month high on Wednesday as exporters received a boost from astronger dollar following firm U.S. housing data, while SonyCorp soared after releasing earnings.,TOKYO, May 25 Japanese stocks rebounded onWednesday morning as exporters received a boost from a strongerdollar following firm U.S. housing data and as growing supportfor the British campaign to remain in the European Unionbolstered global risk appetite.

Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp on Tuesday forecast weaker-than-expected earnings this year after partially halting production of its cash-cow image sensors last month to assess earthquake damage to its factory.,* Cancels development of some high-end camera modules (Adds graphic),* Says it will fully resume operations at Kumamoto plant byend-august (Reporting by Makiko Yamazaki),TOKYO, May 24 Japan's Sony Corp said onTuesday it expects operating profit to rise just 2 percent inthe year through March 2017, weighed down by damage from deadlyearthquakes that halted production at its image sensor plant inKumamoto.,* Sony: sees fy2016/17 devices unit operating loss of 40billion yen ($366 million) versus 29.2 billion yen loss last fy

Title: Microsoft to buy LinkedIn for $26.2 billion in its largest deal,UPDATE 2-Microsoft unveils slimmer Xbox; Sony's VR headset to hit US in Oct
Body: Microsoft Corp will buy LinkedIn Corp for $26.2 billion in its biggest-ever deal, a bold stroke by Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella in his efforts to make the venerable software company a major force in next-generation computing. |¶ÿ,June 13 Microsoft Corp unveiled'Project Scorpio', a new Xbox console that will supportultra-high resolution gaming and virtual reality, while alsolaunching a slimmer version of its Xbox One console at the videogame conference E3 in Los Angeles on Monday.

Title: Microsoft unveils slimmer Xbox; Sony's VR headset to hit U.S. in October
Body: Microsoft Corp  unveiled 'Project Scorpio', a new Xbox console that will support ultra-high resolution gaming and virtual reality, while also launching a slimmer version of its Xbox One console at the video game conference E3 in Los Angeles on Monday. |¶ÿ

Title: After copyright smackdown, Sony gets fees in Shakira case
Body: A federal judge has awarded Sony Corp $400,000 in attorneys'fees after ruling that music publisher Mayimba Music Inc'sclaims that a hit song by pop star Shakira was an illegal copyof a Dominican songwriter's work were based on fraud.

Title: Japan's Murata aims to boost automotive revenue with Sony battery buy

Body: KIKUYO-MACHI, Japan Sony Corp's image sensor production will return to full capacity in the October-March half-year due to a pickup in smartphone demand, having spent part of the past year running just under full strength, the head of its chip-making subsidiary said.,* Clients' business environment is improving -chip-makingchief

Title: Sony enters virtual reality race with PlayStation VR headset,Sony enters virtual reality race with PlayStation VR headset
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp will join the race for virtual reality (VR) dominance on Thursday with the $399 PlayStation VR, a headset the Japanese electronics group hopes will beat pricier rivals and revive its reputation as a maker of must-have gadgets.,TOKYO, Oct 12 Sony Corp will join therace for virtual reality (VR) dominance on Thursday with the$399 PlayStation VR, a headset the Japanese electronics grouphopes will beat pricier rivals and revive its reputation as amaker of must-have gadgets.

Title: Sony unveils new versions of PlayStation 4
Body: Sony Interactive Entertainment, a division of Sony Corp , unveiled on Wednesday two new versions of its PlayStation 4 Console in an effort to help Sony maintain its sales lead over Microsoft Corp  and Nintendo Co Ltd . |¶ÿ

Title: Sony surprises with profit warning on sale of battery business,UPDATE 1-Sony surprises with profit warning on sale of battery business,Sony cuts annual profit outlook due to sale of battery business
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  cut its annual profit outlook due to losses related to the sale of its battery business - disappointing a market that had been hoping for an upward revision on buoyant sales momentum for PlayStation 4 and the launch of its virtual reality headset.,* Cuts operating profit outlook to Y270 bln vs Y309 blnestimate,TOKYO, Oct 31 Sony Corp said on Mondayit was cutting its annual profit outlook due to impairmentlosses related to the sale of its battery business to MurataManufacturing Co.

Title: Sony bullish on sensors after quake causes quarterly profit to halve,UPDATE 2-Sony bullish on sensors after quake causes quarterly profit to halve,Sony reports Q2 operating profit plunge as quake impact lingers
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp on Tuesday said it remained bullish about the long-term prospects of its cash-cow imaging sensor business after earthquake damage to a major factory contributed to a 48 percent drop in quarterly profit.,* Chips unit, featuring image sensors, swings to loss (Adds CFO comments, move toward automotive market),TOKYO, Nov 1 Japan's Sony Corp onTuesday reported a 48 percent decline in operating profit forthe July-September quarter as earthquake damage continued toaffect its cash-cow imaging sensor business.

Title: Japan Display in talks for 75 bln yen bailout from INCJ - WSJ
Body: Nov 11 Japan Display Inc is in advancedtalks to receive a bailout amount of about 75 billion yen($704.49 million) from Innovation Network Corp of Japan (INCJ),a government-backed fund and the display maker's largestshareholder, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

Title: Japan Display to raise stake in OLED display maker Joled: Nikkei
Body: TOKYO Japan Display Inc  will pay more than $100 million to boost its stake in an organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panel maker, the Nikkei business daily said - a step that would improve its position in a key technology where it lags far behind rivals.

Title: Sony's PlayStation 4 sales top 50 million units worldwide,Sony to release six smartphone games to accelerate mobile drive
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Wednesday sales of its PlayStation 4 video game console had exceeded 50 million units as of Dec 6 helped by strong demand during the year-end holiday season.,TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  will release as many as six smartphone games in the next financial year, hoping that its own gaming franchises can replicate the success of console rival Nintendo Co's  Pokemon GO.

Body: Jan 18 Former Beatle Paul McCartney sued SonyCorp's music publishing arm on Wednesday in a federalcourt in New York, seeking to get back the copyrights to musicof his former band, court records show.,WASHINGTON The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Wednesday it had launched on investigation into whether Fujifilm Holdings Corp was violating patents which Sony Corp holds for certain magnetic tape cartridges.,WASHINGTON, Jan 18 The U.S. International TradeCommission said on Wednesday it had launched on investigationinto whether Fujifilm Holdings Corp was violatingpatents which Sony Corp holds for certain magnetic tapecartridges.

Title: Sony takes $1 billion writedown on its movie business,UPDATE 4-Sony takes $1 bln writedown on its movie business,BRIEF-Sony to sell 5.3 pct stake in M3 Inc for 52 bln yen,Sony shares dip on movie business impairment charge
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp  will write down the value of its movie business by nearly 112.1 billion yen ($976 million) in the third quarter, blaming weaker film profits as online streaming services sap demand for movie DVDs.,* To record 37 bln yen gain within operating income fromsale (Adds background on market share),* Says the co to sell 5.3 percent stake in M3 Inc for 52 billion yen,TOKYO, Jan 31 Sony Corp's shares slidas much as 4 percent on Tuesday to 3,362 yen after the companysaid it had booked a 112.1 billion yen ($986.97 million)impairment charge on the goodwill value of its movie segment inthe quarter ended December.

Title: Sony takes $976 mln charge on film segment in Oct-Dec,BRIEF-Sony to cut stake in M3 Inc to 34 pct from 39.3 pct
Body: TOKYO, Jan 30 Sony Corp said on Mondayit booked an impairment charge of 112.1 billion yen ($976million) on the goodwill value of its film segment inOctober-December.,* Says the co plans to cut stake in M3 Inc to 34percent from 39.3 percent

Title: Fitch: Current Problems Delay, Not Derail, Sony's Turnaround,Nikkei edges down in choppy trade; bank shares outperform
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)SEOUL/SYDNEY, February 03 (Fitch) Sony Corporation's(BB/Positive) strong commitment to increasing profitability through restructuring andcost-cutting will improve its credit profile over the medium to long term,although the struggling movie and smartphone businesses may delay Sony'srecovery and overshadow its expanding semiconductor and solid gamingbusinesses in the short term, says Fitch Ratings. The company's theatrical rev,TOKYO, Feb 3 Japan's Nikkei edged down in choppytrade on Friday, as investors awaited the release of the U.S.monthly jobs report that will set the tone for the FederalReserve's policy outlook, while bank stocks outperformed onhigher yields.

Title: Sony rules out pictures biz sale, committed to turnaround,UPDATE 2-Sony rules out pictures biz sale, committed to turnaround,BRIEF-Sony CFO says no possibility of selling pictures business,Sony cuts annual profit view on movie business writedown
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp on Thursday said it does not plan to sell its pictures business after suffering a $1 billion writedown, and instead aims to turn it around by adding sales channels and making more use of movie characters.,* Pictures profit sacrificed during electronics turnaround-CFO (Adds CFO comments, earnings details, background),* pictures segment unlikely to achieve earnings target inyear ending March 2018,TOKYO, Feb 2 Sony Corp on Thursday cutits full-year outlook for operating profit on Thursday after theJapanese TV-to-gaming group took a $1 billion writedown on itsstruggling movie business.

Title: UPDATE 2-Facebook's Oculus cuts price of virtual reality set by $200
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, March 1 Facebook Inc'svirtual reality unit Oculus has cut $200 from the total price ofits flagship hardware set, in a bid to expand the system's baseof video game players, the company said on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 2-Facebook's Oculus cuts price of virtual reality set by $200
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, March 1 Facebook Inc'svirtual reality unit Oculus has cut $200 from the total price ofits flagship hardware set, in a bid to expand the system's baseof video game players, the company said on Wednesday.

Title: U.S. ITC to investigate Sony patent infringement claims against Arris,U.S. ITC to investigate Sony patent infringement claims against Arris
Body: WASHINGTON The U.S. International Trade Commission said on Wednesday it has launched a patent infringement investigation of television set-top boxes and other components that Arris International supplies to Comcast Corp and DirecTV for their Xfinity and Genie customers.,WASHINGTON, April 12 The U.S. InternationalTrade Commission said on Wednesday it has launched a patentinfringement investigation of television set-top boxes and othercomponents that Arris International supplies to Comcast Corpand DirecTV for their Xfinity and Geniecustomers.

Title: China's Hisense Electric becomes FIFA sponsor,China's Hisense Electric becomes FIFA sponsor
Body: Consumer electronics maker Hisense Electric Co Ltd said it had become an official sponsor of FIFA, making it the latest Chinese company to partner with the global soccer governing body.,April 6 Consumer electronics maker HisenseElectric Co Ltd said it had become an officialsponsor of FIFA, making it the latest Chinese company to partnerwith the global soccer governing body.

Title: Sony lifts annual profit estimate on lower amortization costs,Sony lifts annual profit estimate on lower amortisation costs
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  raised its operating profit estimate for the year ended March 31 thanks to lower amortization costs for its financial services segment.,TOKYO, April 21 Japan's Sony Corpraised its operating profit estimate for the year ended March 31thanks to lower amortisation costs for its financial servicessegment.

Title: Sony sees surge in chip demand pushing profit nearing 20-year record,UPDATE 2-Sony sees surge in chip demand pushing profit nearing 20-year record,Sony expects 73.2 pct annual profit jump as it recovers from quake damage
Body: TOKYO Sony Corp on Friday said it expects annual profit to surge 73 percent, closing in on a two decade-old record, as its cash-cow image sensor business recovers from quake damage just as smartphone makers start loading handsets with more sensors.,* PlayStation 4 has entered harvest period -CFO(Adds CFO comments),TOKYO, April 28 Sony Corp said onFriday it expects operating profit to rise 73.2 percent in thefinancial year through March 2018 as its cash-cow image sensorbusiness recovers from earthquake damage that had suspended akey plant in southern Japan.

Title: Sony taps Vinciquerra to lead Sony film, TV studio,UPDATE 1-Sony taps Vinciquerra to lead Sony film, TV studio,Sony taps Vinciquerra to lead Sony Pictures Entertainment
Body: LOS ANGELES Sony Corp on Thursday named former Fox television executive Anthony Vinciquerra as chairman and chief executive of Sony Pictures Entertainment, effective June 1.,LOS ANGELES, May 11 Sony Corp onThursday named former Fox television executive AnthonyVinciquerra as chairman and chief executive of Sony PicturesEntertainment, effective June 1.,LOS ANGELES, May 11 Sony Corp has namedformer Fox executive Anthony Vinciquerra the new chairman andchief executive of Sony Pictures Entertainment, the company saidin a statement on Thursday.Vinciquerra's appointment is effective June 1. He replacesMichael Lynton, who announced in January that he would step downin the spring.(Reporting by Lisa Richwine)

Title: RPT-Sony's PlayStation VR headset sales top 1 million units,Sony's PlayStation VR headset sales top one million units,Sony's PlayStation VR headset sales top 1 million units,Japan Display considers deeper restructuring, seeks more funding -Nikkei
Body: TOKYO, June 7 Sony Corp has sold morethan one million units of its virtual reality (VR) headsetglobally, the Asia chief of the Japanese firm's gaming unit saidon Wednesday, as a relatively low price helps push the productinto an early lead.,TOKYO Sony Corp has sold more than one million units of its virtual reality (VR) headset globally, the Asia chief of the Japanese firm's gaming unit said on Wednesday, as a relatively low price helps push the product into an early lead.,TOKYO, June 7 Sony Corp has sold morethan one million units of its virtual reality (VR) headsetglobally, the Asia chief of the Japanese firm's gaming unit saidon Wednesday, as a relatively low price helps push the productinto an early lead.,TOKYO, June 7 Japan Display Inc isconsidering deeper restructuring than first planned and hasasked a state-backed fund for help after losing business withApple Inc due to its late entry into OLED technology,the Nikkei business daily reported.
